           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3 style="text-align: center;">
             The EMABG is a joint master programme that fulfils a real need for the industry sector and for society as a whole. It is designed to answer the scientific, practical, and societal challenges of animal breeding, biodiversity and genomics.

         <div class="avia_message_box avia-color-custom avia-size-large avia-icon_select-yes avia-border- avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" id="avia-messagebox-" style="background-color:#e2372b; color:#ffffff; ">
          <span class="avia_message_box_title">
           Great news:
          </span>
          <div class="avia_message_box_content">
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="avia_message_box_icon" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello">
           </span>
           <p>
            There are scholarships available for intake in 2025! Additionally, we have extended the deadline for applications until 28 February 2025.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-3 el_after_av_notification el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              EMABG Programme
             </h4>
             <p>
              The domain of animal breeding and genetics has undergone a revolution in the recent decade. The availability of high throughput genomic markers as well as phenotypic data from automated recording systems resulted in dramatic change in the understanding of genetic mechanisms and in the way livestock and aquaculture species are bred. The European Master in Animal Biodiversity and Genomics (EMABG), a 2-year Master course, responds to a sharply increased demand of industry and academia for people very well skilled in reflecting and dealing with this kind of data.
             </p>
             <p>
              <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/programme/about-the-emabg/">
               More about the EMABG
              </a>
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>

             <span class="hr-inner-style">

          </a>
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock av_inherit_color" itemprop="text" style="color:#ffffff; ">

             Application Information
            </h2>
           </div>

         <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_div avia-builder-el-10 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Five areas of specialisation
            </h3>
            <p>
             Study at 2 of 6 leading European universities that ensure the excellence in teaching and research in animal biodiversity, breeding and genomics.
            </p>
            <p>
             Specialise in one of following areas:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Conservation genomics for rare and endangered breeds and species;
             </li>
             <li>
              Designing and implementing breeding programmes for small populations;
             </li>
             <li>
              Bioinformatics applied to biodiversity and genomics;
             </li>
             <li>
              One health: Health and welfare in humans and animals;
             </li>
             <li>
              Understanding biodiversity: integrative biology.
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>

           <h2>

    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-715">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="avia_message_box avia-color-custom avia-size-large avia-icon_select-yes avia-border- avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" id="avia-messagebox-" style="background-color:#e2372b; color:#ffffff; ">
          <span class="avia_message_box_title">
           Great news:
          </span>
          <div class="avia_message_box_content">
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="avia_message_box_icon" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello">
           </span>
           <p>
            There are scholarships available for intake in 2025! Additionally, we have extended the deadline for applications until 28 February 2025.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle first avia-builder-el-3 el_after_av_notification el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              EMABG Programme
             </h4>
             <p>
              Our vision is to equip the future leaders and adept problem solvers with cutting-edge knowledge to address the urgent challenges of biodiversity decline and global food security. Our vision extends beyond academia to encompass industry and society at large. EMABG aspires to be a driving force in providing interdisciplinary education in Europe and worldwide. We build upon our proven track record in animal breeding and genetics, extend our reach, and bring innovative solutions to halt biodiversity loss, using the state-of-the-art toolset of genomics. Aligned with our mission of academic excellence and utilising our complementary strengths, EMABG will make a lasting impact on the entire society.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left avia-full-stretch flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle avia-builder-el-5 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background:url(https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/DSCF6852-e1568221497480.jpg) center center no-repeat  #ededed; padding:00px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-6 avia-builder-el-no-sibling" style="height:200px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->
         <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-7 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half" style="height:40px">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left avia-full-stretch flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-8 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="background:url(https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/CONTENT_PIX_01a.jpg) center center no-repeat  #ededed; padding:00px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-9 avia-builder-el-no-sibling" style="height:200px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top avia-builder-el-10 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Challenges
             </h4>
             <p>
              The EMABG is a joint master programme that fills a real need for both the industry and nongovernmental sector and society as a whole. It is designed to answer the scientific, practical and societal challenges of ABG. These challenges can be summarised for both developed and low-income countries as follows:
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               preserve natural resources, with special attention to biodiversity;
              </li>
              <li>
               meet the increased demand for animal and fish products, while preserving or improving the quality of the products, the welfare of animals and minimising the environmental impact;
              </li>
              <li>
               make efficient use of novel tools and technologies to reach these goals while maintaining societal acceptance of animal food production;
              </li>
              <li>
               develop sustainable animal breeding and conservation programmes that contribute to improved livelihood of farmers and efficient food chains in a long-term perspective;
              </li>
              <li>
               develop sustainable breeding and conservation programmes for rare and indigenous breeds that contribute to nature inclusive farming, and for endangered species to be reintroduced in nature reserves.
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->
         <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-12 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half" style="height:40px">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-13 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Goals
             </h4>
             <p>
              It is a common vision of EMABG partners to meet these challenges by intensive cooperation in the education and training of students, further enhanced by the complementarity among participating universities. Thus, the EMABG was set up to;
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               offer quality higher education with a European perspective in the field of animal biodiversity and genomics, which is attractive to students from EU Member States and third countries associated to the Programme, as well as students from third countries not associated to the Programme;
              </li>
              <li>
               enhance the quality of training in animal biodiversity and genomics and to strengthen attractiveness of the European Higher Education Area;
              </li>
              <li>
               contribute to the needs of societies by developing the qualifications of people so they possess the appropriate skills, are open-minded and internationally experienced.
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </section>

    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-704">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              After completion of the EMABG course, graduates will be able to:
             </h4>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-4 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <ul>
              <li>
               Describe the current world context of animal biodiversity, and reflect on its social and ethical aspects.
              </li>
              <li>
               Show knowledge of biostatistics, quantitative and molecular genetics, and use correct scientific vocabulary.
              </li>
              <li>
               Identify and critically analyse key factors and forces related to challenges in management and utilisation of animal biodiversity and relate the discipline to a multidisciplinary framework.
              </li>
              <li>
               Create a solution for a given problem by applying appropriate research methods, instruments and tools, and organise, monitor, and evaluate results within their specialisation, while
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </section>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              – collecting relevant information and literature, understanding and applying required methods to conduct research;
              <br/>
              – reflecting critically on own and literature research work, and adjusting and suggesting improvement of the analysis;
              <br/>
              – concluding and pointing out practical recommendations based on analysis of results.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <ul>
              <li>
               Present an oral and written report of study and research activities, considering the nature of the audience.
              </li>
              <li>
               Adapt and apply their knowledge to different working and cultural environments.
              </li>
              <li>
               Demonstrate the learning and organisational skills to continue to study in a manner that may be largely self-directed or autonomous.
              </li>
              <li>
               Operate in an international context in both content and social-cultural aspects, both independently and in a team.
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left avia-full-stretch flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top avia-builder-el-8 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background:url(https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/CONTENT_PIX_05.jpg) center center no-repeat  #ededed; padding:00px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">

       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-707">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
          <div class="avia_textblock av_inherit_color" itemprop="text" style="color:#ffffff; ">
           <h2>
            Employability
           </h2>
          </div>
         </section>
        </div>
       </div>
      </main>
      <!-- close content main element -->
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-707">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle first avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h3>
              Training experts of tomorrow
             </h3>
             <p>
              EMABG offers a well-structured study programme that is unique in the possibilities of specialisations. These specialisations correspond with the strengths of the respective universities both in teaching and research. The specialisations focus on the main areas of modern research in biodiversity and genomics and provide students with excellent knowledge and relevant skills for successfully targeting the cutting-edge questions of genetic research as young scientists. These young scientists will graduate as specialised experts with a broad, interdisciplinary and international background. Graduates with those properties will become the elite experts and scientists of tomorrow who will make good use of their network with their EMABG universities. Thus, the already strong excellence network between the EMABG universities will be sustained, advanced and improved by the next generation.
             </p>
             <p>
              Visit our
              <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/students/alumni/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               alumni page
              </a>
              to browse through the careers of former EMABG students.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle avia-builder-el-4 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h3>
              Specialisation and interdisciplinarity
             </h3>
             <p>
              The already highly competitive field of animal biodiversity will profit from those young professionals who will be thoroughly trained for the many specialised fields. By the structure of EMABG the focus and contents of its education offer clear profiles to both students and possible employers. This kind of profile is new in European higher education for animal biodiversity and genomics. Also, the interdisciplinary methodological contributions will produce alumni of an as yet highly uncommon combination of knowledge and skills in graduates, which will contribute to their employability and future synergies within the field.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->
         <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-6 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half" style="height:40px">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle first avia-builder-el-7 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h3>
              Education and skills
             </h3>
             <p>
              The EMABG program offers a structured approach to courses and teaching methods, combining classroom lectures with practical exercises focused on real-world problems. The program aims to develop professionals with T-shaped skills: deep knowledge in specific disciplines and a broad understanding of societal contexts. The six partner universities contribute their scientific expertise in animal biodiversity and genomics, offering students the flexibility to choose a study track. This ensures a strong academic profile and develops essential soft skills and international experiences. Each university specializes in different aspects of animal biodiversity and genomics, providing students with the best education tailored to their chosen focus.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">

    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-2924">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <p>
             The EMABG is a 2-year study programme (120 ETCS) and builds on MSc courses that already exist in the different consortium universities. It concentrates on the development of scientific expertise in the areas of quantitative, population and molecular genetics related to animal breeding and biodiversity. This involves five study tracks:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Conservation genomics for rare and endangered breeds and species (WUR)
             </li>
             <li>
              Designing and implementing breeding programmes for small populations (BOKU)
             </li>
             <li>
              Bioinformatics applied to biodiversity and genomics (SLU)
             </li>
             <li>
              One health: Health and welfare in humans and animals (UGOE)
             </li>
             <li>
              Understanding biodiversity: integrative biology (APT)
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-4 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_textblock" style="border-radius:0px; ">

                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   10 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain in-depth knowledge of population genetics, molecular data analysis, and evolutionary forces, preparing them for advanced studies. They also gain practical skills in critical analysis of genetic data, and understanding cutting-edge research articles in molecular evolution.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>

               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/course/bio322" target="_blank">

                   10 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  The students will gain a conceptual understanding of utilizing complex genomic data. Emphasis is on studying molecular mechanisms across species, individuals, and cells, gaining insight into biological phenomena at various levels, practical experience in analysis methods and result interpretation.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>

                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   10 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain theoretical knowledge, analytical skills for diverse data types, and competence in optimizing phenotypic measurements for precision farming.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/course/bin301" target="_blank">

                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   10 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain insights into cutting-edge genetic value predictions for animals and plants, enhancing breeding programs. The learn to predict genetic values using SNP- and G-BLUP, pedigree-based BLUP, focusing on animal models. Topics include model bias, prediction error calculation, and constructing mixed models with multiple random effects. Students learn R programming, and diverse applications used in animal breeding and genetics.

                  </div>
                 </div>

                  <br/>
                  transversal skills, and their awareness, and sense of responsibility towards global challenges.

                 </div>
                </div>

                <span class="BxUVEf ILfuVd" lang="en">
                 <span class="hgKElc">
                  Norwegian University of Life Sciences
                 </span>
                </span>
                , Norway
                <br/>
               </strong>
              </h4>
             </div>
            </section>
            <div class="av-catalogue-container avia-builder-el-50 el_after_av_textblock avia-builder-el-last">
             <ul class="av-catalogue-list">
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/course/bio321">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Population Genetics and Molecular Evolution
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   10 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain in-depth knowledge of population genetics, molecular data analysis, and evolutionary forces, preparing them for advanced studies. They also gain practical skills in critical analysis of genetic data, and understanding cutting-edge research articles in molecular evolution.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/course/bio322" target="_blank">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Advanced Topics in Genomics
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   10 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  The students will gain a conceptual understanding of utilizing complex genomic data. Emphasis is on studying molecular mechanisms across species, individuals, and cells, gaining insight into biological phenomena at various levels, practical experience in analysis methods and result interpretation.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/course/bin302" target="_blank">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Advanced Analysis for High Throughput Phenotyping and Precision Farming
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   10 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain theoretical knowledge, analytical skills for diverse data types, and competence in optimizing phenotypic measurements for precision farming.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/course/bin301" target="_blank">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Genomic and Pedigree-Based Prediction of Genetic Value
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   10 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain insights into cutting-edge genetic value predictions for animals and plants, enhancing breeding programs. The learn to predict genetic values using SNP- and G-BLUP, pedigree-based BLUP, focusing on animal models. Topics include model bias, prediction error calculation, and constructing mixed models with multiple random effects. Students learn R programming, and diverse applications used in animal breeding and genetics.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>

            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">

               Semester 2
               <br/>

             </h4>
            </div>

           <div class="flex_column av_one_full flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-56 el_after_av_one_third el_before_av_hr column-top-margin" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
            <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
              <h4 style="text-align: center;">
               <strong>
                <span class="BxUVEf ILfuVd" lang="en">
                 <span class="hgKElc">
                  Wageningen University & Research, Netherlands
                 </span>
                </span>
                <br/>
               </strong>
              </h4>
             </div>
            </section>
            <div class="av-catalogue-container avia-builder-el-58 el_after_av_textblock avia-builder-el-last">
             <ul class="av-catalogue-list">
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://wur.osiris-student.nl/onderwijscatalogus/extern/cursus">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Life History Evolution
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  The course will cover basic life history theory by highlighting major decisions animals have to make with respect to reproduction and adaptation. Life history decisions are very fundamental for wildlife biology as they affect fitness and thus animal biodiversity through natural selection. The course will focus on life history in vertebrates and is part of the minor in Wildlife Biodiversity.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://wur.osiris-student.nl/onderwijscatalogus/extern/cursus">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Programming in Python
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Programming plays an important role in many domains. This course aims to help students to understand the underlying principles of programming and equip them with basic skills to create computer programs. The programming language Python serves broad application domains. Furthermore, Python is the most commonly used programming language in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://wur.osiris-student.nl/onderwijscatalogus/extern/cursus">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Breeding Lab
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  The course is scheduled as a combination of a ‘group internship’ at a given company and a set of skills training and exercises. Groups of students will do a domain-related assignment. This assignment should comply with the following criteria: it should be a commissioned multidisciplinary assignment, concern a real authentic case, offer a certain level of complexity, reflecting various interests and stakeholders, and it should require an academic level to address the issue.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://wur.osiris-student.nl/onderwijscatalogus/extern/cursus">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Wildlife Conservation Genetics
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  In this course we will start by discussing the basic concepts of conservation genetics. We will discuss how to measure genetic variation using pedigree and molecular data. We also discuss the various evolutionary forces that shape genetic variation in both wild and captive populations. The relevance of biodiversity in relation to scientific, ethical and societal questions will be dealt with in a variety of (guest) lectures.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://wur.osiris-student.nl/onderwijscatalogus/extern/cursus">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Population and Quantitative Genetics
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  This course explains genetic and molecular evolution and their relationship to phenotypic evolution, of natural, captive and domesticated populations of living organisms, ranging from microbes to plants and animals. The course deals with the dynamics of genetic variation, by evaluating the effect of and the equilibrium between mutation, natural selection, genetic drift and migration. Furthermore, it deals with the translation of genotypic variation to phenotypic variation in interaction with environmental variation. Understanding the dynamics of genetic variation, and its translation to a phenotype, is not only important for understanding past and predicting future evolutionary change, but also for its relationship to biodiversity.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
             </ul>

                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">

                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Upon completion students will be able to describe the content and structure of breeding program basics for plants and animals. They will understand the objectives, and will be able tro discuss planning, performance testing, biotechnologies, and breeding goals. They will be able to describe the specific differences for crops and livestock and animals kept in game parks.
                  <br/>

              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://ecampus.uni-goettingen.de/h1/pages/startFlow.xhtml?_flowId=searchCourseNonStaff-flow&_flowExecutionKey=e1s9">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">

                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Upon completion students wil be able to recall and implement basic statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, regression, and correlation analysis for practical analyses. Using
                  <br/>
                  practical examples and exercises, they will be able to understand, describe and discuss the connections between theoretical concepts of the statistical approaches and their practical implementations and use.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <div class="av-catalogue-item">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Breeding Lab Internship
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   9 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Upon completion students will develop management, communication, and collaboration, and conflict management skills. They gain insights into industry practices, responsibility areas, and professional life in animal breeding. In a non-university setting, they experience a specialized working environment. Students will be able to gather, analyze, and integrate information for R&D propositions, demonstrating systematic evaluation and cultural awareness in decision-making.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://ecampus.uni-goettingen.de/h1/pages/startFlow.xhtml?_flowId=searchCourseNonStaff-flow&_flowExecutionKey=e1s20">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">

                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Upon completion students will be able to analyze animal breeding and genetics related data in the R software environment, covering various data types, workflow automation, and third-party software integration. Students will be efficiently use R on large animal datasets, implement automated workflows, and distribute implementations and reports to endusers.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://ecampus.uni-goettingen.de/h1/pages/startFlow.xhtml?_flowId=searchCourseNonStaff-flow&_flowExecutionKey=e1s25">

                  </div>
                 </div>

They will be able to recall and implement basic bioinformatics concepts, to analyze large datasets for breeding purposes.

                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Epidemiology of international and tropical animal infectious diseases
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Upon completion students gain a broad understanding of infectious diseases, including zoonotic risks and global surveillance efforts. They acquire specialized knowledge in the biology of infectious agents, immunology, diagnostic methods, and environmental impacts. They will be able to discuss microbiological and parasitological diagnostics, biochemical, immunological, biotechnological, and molecular techniques. Students will be also able to evaluate and develop effective livestock hygiene concepts, integrate them into quality management, and contribute to multidisciplinary epizootic control programs.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </li>
              <li>

                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Statistical genetics, breeding informatics and experimental design
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Upon completion students will be able to analyze data using a wide range of methods, such as gene expression, genome-wide association, QTL mapping, statistical hypothesis testing, regression, and other experimental designs. They will be able to describe and apply the fundamental concepts for their analysis using data size estimation, programming, and database management. The focus will be placed on utilizing large biotechnological datasets, as well as planning efficient experiments.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <div class="av-catalogue-item">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Advanced methods in animal breeding and statistical genetics
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Upon completion students will be able to critically review and analyze quantitative-genetic data in animal breeding and statistical genetics. They will be able to apply methods for parameter estimation, breeding value assessment, genetic diversity management, and genomic analysis to simulated , but also practical data sets using specialized computer programs.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://ecampus.uni-goettingen.de/h1/pages/startFlow.xhtml?_flowId=searchCourseNonStaff-flow&_flowExecutionKey=e1s19">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">
                 <div class="av-catalogue-title-container">
                  <div class="av-catalogue-title">
                   Quantitative genetics and population genetics
                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain comprehensive understanding of population genetics, quantitative genetics, and dynamics of genetic variability. They apply theoretical concepts through practical computer exercises, exploring topics such as gene frequencies, phenotypic variance, and selection signatures. Advanced knowledge covers quantitative genetics models, breeding values, relatedness, inbreeding, crossbreeding and heterosis.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://ecampus.uni-goettingen.de/h1/pages/startFlow.xhtml?_flowId=searchCourseNonStaff-flow&_flowExecutionKey=e1s23">
                <div class="av-catalogue-item-inner">

                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   6 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain expertise in genetics, biotechnologies for animal and plant breeding, and molecular genetics tools. They develop skills to decipher traits, use genetic tools effectively, and creatively solve breeding challenges, fostering global thinking and effective communication.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>

                  </div>

They also gain practical skills in critical analysis of genetic data, and understanding cutting-edge research articles in molecular evolution.

                </div>

              </li>
              <li>

                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">

                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  The students will gain a conceptual understanding of utilizing complex genomic data. Emphasis is on studying molecular mechanisms across species, individuals, and cells, gaining insight into biological phenomena at various levels, practical experience in analysis methods and result interpretation.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>
              <li>
               <a class="av-catalogue-item" href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/course/bin302" target="_blank">

                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain theoretical knowledge, analytical skills for diverse data types, and competence in optimizing phenotypic measurements for precision farming.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>
              </li>

                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">

                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students gain insights into cutting-edge genetic value predictions for animals and plants, enhancing breeding programs. The learn to predict genetic values using SNP- and G-BLUP, pedigree-based BLUP, focusing on animal models. Topics include model bias, prediction error calculation, and constructing mixed models with multiple random effects. Students learn R programming, and diverse applications used in animal breeding and genetics.

                  </div>

                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  After completion, students will proficiently conduct statistical analyses using R programming, visualizing and manipulating data, and creating custom functions. They will
                  <br/>
                  understand programming’s role in automating statistical computations and possess skills to interpret model output, read various file formats, and troubleshoot errors. Students will be able to craft clear, reproducible reports integrating text, code, and output. Overall, they will be well-equipped to apply statistical methods in later studies and professional contexts.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>

              </li>
              <li>

                  </div>
                  <div class="av-catalogue-price">
                   5 ECTS
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="av-catalogue-content">
                  Students will acquire in-depth knowledge of sustainable food systems and apply it to complex problems. They’ll assess sustainability at different spatial levels, considering
                  <br/>
                  interactions with development goals. Skills include interdisciplinary teamwork, advanced scientific literature analysis, and effective communication of sustainable food solutions. General gained competences involve utilizing knowledge to address complex sustainability and food production issues, communicating professionally, and conducting scientific studies in the field.
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </a>

   function av_privacy_cookie_setter( cookie_name ) {var toggle = jQuery('.' + cookie_name);toggle.each(function(){if(document.cookie.match(cookie_name)) this.checked = false;});jQuery('.' + 'av-switch-' + cookie_name).each(function(){this.className += ' active ';});toggle.on('click', function(){if(this.checked){document.cookie = cookie_name + '=; Path=/; Expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:01 GMT;';}else{var theDate = new Date();var oneYearLater = new Date( theDate.getTime() + 31536000000 );document.cookie = cookie_name + '=true; Path=/; Expires='+oneYearLater.toGMTString()+';';}});}; av_privacy_cookie_setter('aviaPrivacyGoogleWebfontsDisabled');  av_privacy_cookie_setter('aviaPrivacyGoogleMapsDisabled');  av_privacy_cookie_setter('aviaPrivacyVideoEmbedsDisabled');

     <div class="container">
      <main class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units" itemprop="mainContentOfPage" role="main">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-653">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
          <div class="avia_textblock av_inherit_color" itemprop="text" style="color:#ffffff; ">
           <h2>
            Admission Requirements
           </h2>
          </div>
         </section>
        </div>

      <!-- close content main element -->
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-653">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="avia_message_box avia-color-custom avia-size-large avia-icon_select-yes avia-border- avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" id="avia-messagebox-" style="background-color:#e27a2b; color:#ffffff; ">
          <span class="avia_message_box_title">
           Thank you for all the applications:
          </span>
          <div class="avia_message_box_content">
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="avia_message_box_icon" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello">
           </span>
           <p>
            The application period for the master’s program has closed.
            <br/>
            The next intake will be organized in October/November. See you in autumn!
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-3 el_after_av_notification el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Please check that you meet the following requirements for EMABG:
             </h4>
             <ul>
              <li>
               Academic Bachelor of Science Degree (minimum 180 ECTS) in animal science. An equivalent degree from related fields, such as agricultural sciences, veterinary medicine, zoology, botany, microbiology or similar is also accepted, if basics of genetics or animal breeding knowledge is documented in the transcript of records.
              </li>
              <li>
               Language Proficiency: A good knowledge of English is a prerequisite for an application.
              </li>
              <li>
               Students are required to pass a language proficiency exam meeting the following minimum requirements:
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </section>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <ul>
              <li style="text-align: left;">
               TOEFL IBT: at least 92 (minimum of 23 in the sub-score “speaking”)
              </li>
              <li>
               TOEFL paper based or ITP cannot be accepted.
              </li>
              <li>
               <strong>
                TOEFL IBT Special Home Edition can be accepted but students might have to take another test for their second year university.
                <br/>
               </strong>
              </li>
              <li>
               ACADEMIC IELTS: at least 6.5 (minimum of 6.0 in the sub-score “speaking”)
              </li>
              <li>
               <strong>
                IELTS online test and IELTS One Skill Retake are not accepted)
               </strong>
              </li>
              <li>
               CAMBRIDGE CAE/C1 Advanced: score between 180-210, Grade C
              </li>
              <li>
               CAMBRIDGE CPE/C2 Proficiency: score between 180-230 or Grade C
              </li>
             </ul>
             <p>
              <strong>
               <em>
                The language proficiency certificates should have been taken no longer than two years before the application deadline.
               </em>
              </strong>
             </p>
             <p>
              (Please not that submitting a fake language certificate or any other document is a fraud and will be forwarded to the authorities.)
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top avia-builder-el-6 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Note the following conditions:
             </h4>
             <ul>
              <li>
               Applicants who already hold a
               <strong>
                MSc degree in a similar field of studies
               </strong>
               , cannot be accepted at University of Goettingen.
              </li>
              <li>
               Applicants who have completed their Bachelor or Master Degree in one of the following countries do not need to submit an English language proficiency certificate:
               <br/>
               <strong>
                Australia, Ireland, Canada (except those educated at universities in Quebec), New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States of America
               </strong>
               .
              </li>
              <li>
               Conditions:
               <br/>
               – The programme was conducted completely in the English language.
               <br/>
               – The programme was not part of a double degree programme where part of the programme was conducted in a different country
               <br/>
               – The programme must have been a on campus programme
              </li>
              <li>
               Applicants from these countries should upload their passport (again) in the specific section in the application database.
              </li>
             </ul>
             <h4>
              All other applicants have to submit sufficient results of an English language proficiency certificate as stated in the admission requirements.
             </h4>
             <h3>
              We cannot accept proof of means of education in English from any country other than the ones mentioned above.
             </h3>
             <p>
              Please note: The Consortium partners have the right to request any applicant to submit an English language proficiency test.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>

    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-700">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="avia_message_box avia-color-custom avia-size-large avia-icon_select-yes avia-border- avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_notification avia-builder-el-first" id="avia-messagebox-" style="background-color:#e27a2b; color:#ffffff; ">
          <span class="avia_message_box_title">
           Thank you for all the applications:
          </span>
          <div class="avia_message_box_content">
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="avia_message_box_icon" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello">
           </span>
           <p>
            The application period for the master’s program has closed.
            <br/>
            The next intake will be organized in October/November. See you in autumn!
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="avia_message_box avia-color-custom avia-size-large avia-icon_select-yes avia-border- avia-builder-el-3 el_after_av_notification el_before_av_one_fourth" id="avia-messagebox-" style="background-color:#e8d22c; color:#ffffff; ">
          <span class="avia_message_box_title">
           Important:
          </span>
          <div class="avia_message_box_content">
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="avia_message_box_icon" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello">
           </span>
           <p>
            The new name of the programme is “European Master in Animal Biodiversity and Genomics”!
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_fourth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-4 el_after_av_notification el_before_av_one_half" style="border-radius:0px; ">
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_div avia-builder-el-5 el_after_av_one_fourth el_before_av_one_fourth" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             How to Apply
            </h3>
            <p>
             Students interested in applying for the EMABG must submit the documents listed below via the EMABG application database. Only documents submitted via the application database and only complete applications will be considered.
            </p>
            <p>
             <strong>
              Documents must be submitted in .pdf format.
             </strong>
            </p>
            <p>
             <em>
              The European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), in the context of managing the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees, collects and processes the personal data of some of the candidates. In particular, certain data of the scholarship holders (students and scholars), non-scholarship holders and reserve list candidates is shared with the Agency through the
              <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/mobility/index.cfm">
               EACEA Mobility Tool
              </a>
              and treated according to the following
              <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/mobility/docs/privacy_statement_emt.pdf">
               privacy statement
              </a>
              .
             </em>
            </p>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_fourth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-7 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="border-radius:0px; ">
         </div>
         <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-8 el_after_av_one_fourth el_before_av_one_half" style="height:40px">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-9 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:50px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <article class="iconbox iconbox_left_content avia-builder-el-10 el_before_av_hr avia-builder-el-first" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div aria-hidden="true" class="iconbox_icon heading-color" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello" style="background-color:#009945; border:1px solid #009945; color:#ffffff; ">
            </div>
            <div class="iconbox_content">
             <header class="entry-content-header">
              <h3 class="iconbox_content_title" itemprop="headline">
               Diploma/Certificate of degree
              </h3>
             </header>
             <div class="iconbox_content_container" itemprop="text">
              <p>
               BSc or BSc merged with MSc (if applicable) certificate providing the obtained degree – must be issued by the university where the degree was obtained, and dated, signed and stamped, otherwise it will not be considered valid. Please add an English translation (in one single document) if your documents are not in English.
              </p>
              <p>
               <strong class="highlight">
                Students from China (
                <a href="https://www.aps.org.cn/zh/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                 https://www.aps.org.cn/zh/
                </a>
                ) , Mongolia (
                <a href="https://ulan-bator.diplo.de/mn-de/themen/kultur/-/2076494" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                 https://ulan-bator.diplo.de/mn-de/themen/kultur/-/2076494
                </a>
                ) and Vietnam (
                <a href="https://vietnam.diplo.de/">
                 https://vietnam.diplo.de/
                </a>
                ) need to add the APS certificate to confirm the originality of their documents. Please also send this certificate to emabg(at)boku.ac.at before the application deadline.
               </strong>
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <footer class="entry-footer">
            </footer>
           </article>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-11 el_after_av_icon_box el_before_av_icon_box" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
           <article class="iconbox iconbox_left_content avia-builder-el-12 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_hr" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div aria-hidden="true" class="iconbox_icon heading-color" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello" style="background-color:#009945; border:1px solid #009945; color:#ffffff; ">
            </div>
            <div class="iconbox_content">
             <header class="entry-content-header">
              <h3 class="iconbox_content_title" itemprop="headline">
               Transcript of records
              </h3>
             </header>
             <div class="iconbox_content_container" itemprop="text">
              <p>
               BSc or BSc and MSc (if applicable) transcript of records. Must be issued by the university, stating in detail all courses taken and grades obtained, as well as a grading scale and average grade. Don’t forget to check the backside. This document must be dated, signed and stamped, otherwise it will not be considered valid. Please note that you must upload the transcript of records regarding all the years of your course. Please add an English translation if your documents are not in English. You can ONLY upload ONE SINGLE document. Advice: Merge several pages to a single document here:
               <a href="https://www.pdfmerge.com/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                https://www.pdfmerge.com/
               </a>
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <footer class="entry-footer">
            </footer>
           </article>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-13 el_after_av_icon_box el_before_av_icon_box" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
           <article class="iconbox iconbox_left_content avia-builder-el-14 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_hr" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div aria-hidden="true" class="iconbox_icon heading-color" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello" style="background-color:#009945; border:1px solid #009945; color:#ffffff; ">
            </div>
            <div class="iconbox_content">
             <header class="entry-content-header">
              <h3 class="iconbox_content_title" itemprop="headline">
               Scan of passport
              </h3>
             </header>
             <div class="iconbox_content_container" itemprop="text">
              <p>
               The page containing your personal details and photo.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <footer class="entry-footer">
            </footer>
           </article>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-15 el_after_av_icon_box el_before_av_icon_box" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
           <article class="iconbox iconbox_left_content avia-builder-el-16 el_after_av_hr avia-builder-el-last" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div aria-hidden="true" class="iconbox_icon heading-color" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello" style="background-color:#009945; border:1px solid #009945; color:#ffffff; ">
            </div>
            <div class="iconbox_content">
             <header class="entry-content-header">
              <h3 class="iconbox_content_title" itemprop="headline">
               Certificate of current residence
              </h3>
             </header>
             <div class="iconbox_content_container" itemprop="text">
              <p>
               The certificate of residence must be in English language or translated to English and can be any of the following:
              </p>
              <ul>
               <li>
                a residence certificate issued in accordance with your municipality’s registration rules
               </li>
               <li>
                your national ID, which must be dated and state your current address or merged with a document (e.g. electricity bill) that lists your name and address
               </li>
               <li>
                a certificate from your place of work, study or training issued by the employer or institution in question. This certificate has to be dated and signed.
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p>
               The document must have been issued within 12 months before the submission deadline of applying for an EMJMD student scholarship.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <footer class="entry-footer">
            </footer>
           </article>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top avia-builder-el-17 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:50px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <article class="iconbox iconbox_left_content avia-builder-el-18 el_before_av_hr avia-builder-el-first" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div aria-hidden="true" class="iconbox_icon heading-color" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello" style="background-color:#009945; border:1px solid #009945; color:#ffffff; ">
            </div>
            <div class="iconbox_content">
             <header class="entry-content-header">
              <h3 class="iconbox_content_title" itemprop="headline">
               Curriculum Vitae
              </h3>
             </header>
             <div class="iconbox_content_container" itemprop="text">
              <p>
               preferably in
               <a href="https://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/documents/curriculum-vitae" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                Europass
               </a>
               format;
              </p>
              <p>
               with special emphasis on the duration of employment/additional training, including educational career, working experience, publications, title of research projects/theses. If applicable, any other information of relevance is very much welcome.
              </p>
              <p>

     <div class="av-parallax" data-avia-parallax-ratio="0.3">
      <div class="av-parallax-inner main_color avia-full-stretch" style="background-color: #ededed; background-repeat: no-repeat; background-image: url(https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Picture-by-Myriam-Zilles-on-Pixabay-e1568812944213-1500x554.jpg);background-attachment: scroll; background-position: center center; ">

     <div class="container">
      <main class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units" itemprop="mainContentOfPage" role="main">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-655">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
          <div class="avia_textblock av_inherit_color" itemprop="text" style="color:#ffffff; ">
           <h2>
            Selection and Appeal Procedure
           </h2>
          </div>
         </section>
