    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-655">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div first avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="background: #ededed; border-width:16px; border-style:solid; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Selection Procedure
            </h3>
            <p>
             Students will be selected jointly each year for the 2-year programme by the EMABG selection committee during the annual meeting approx. two weeks after the application deadline. All complete applications that meet the admission criteria will be considered in the student selection. The eligible applications will be evaluated according to four selection criteria:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Academic excellence including English language skills (final score share 40%)
             </li>
             <li>
              Motivation letter (final score share 25%)
             </li>
             <li>
              Work experience/professional qualifications/CV (final score share 25%)
             </li>
             <li>
              Recommendation letters (final score share 10%).
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             Each application is evaluated according to the selection criteria, with scoring in the range of 1 (worst) to 10 (best). The partial scores are weighted based on the final score shares and summed up. Based on these evaluations a provisional ranking is produced. Whenever two or more applicants have the same score, the one with higher academic excellence will be placed first. The selection procedure will aim to maintain geographical and gender balance and will apply equal-opportunity principles.
            </p>
            <h4>
             In most cases we can only select a maximum of 2 candidates per country to maintain cultural and geographic diversity.
            </h4>
            <p>
             <strong>
              We do not hold selection interviews.
             </strong>
            </p>
           </div>
          </section>
          <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-4 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:50px">
           <span class="hr-inner">
            <span class="hr-inner-style">
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Appeal Procedure for Rejected Candidates
            </h3>
            <p>
             Students have the right to appeal against the decision on the rejection of application for a scholarship/acceptance to EMABG, if they believe that their application has not been treated fairly. In this case the applicant must duly justify their reasons for appeal using the
             <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/EMABG_appeal_form.pdf">
              appeal form available under this link
             </a>
             . The form must be signed and needs to be sent (together with any applicable supporting documents) via E-mail to emabg@boku.ac.at within 10 days after notification of the selection results. The EMABG Consortium will review the candidate and reply within 14 days after receiving the appeal, with an explanation and, if applicable, a change in decision-making.
            </p>
            <p>
             Please note that we receive a high number of applications for EMJMD scholarships and competition is very high.
            </p>
            <p>
             In case of questions regarding the selection procedure, you can also contact the EMABG Central Office instead of sending an appeal.
            </p>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div avia-builder-el-6 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_textblock" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Selection Timeline
            </h3>
           </div>
          </section>
          <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-8 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_timeline" style="height:20px">
           <span class="hr-inner">
            <span class="hr-inner-style">
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <div class="avia-timeline-container avia-builder-el-9 el_after_av_hr avia-builder-el-last" id="avia-timeline-67e9887fdc3cc">
           <ul class="avia-timeline avia-timeline-vertical av-milestone-placement-left avia-timeline-boxshadow avia_animate_when_almost_visible avia-timeline-animate">
            <li class="av-milestone av-animated-generic fade-in av-milestone-odd av-milestone-valign-baseline">
             <h2 class="av-milestone-date" id="milestone-mid-oct" style="font-size:16px; ">
              <strong>
               mid Oct
               <span class="av-milestone-indicator" style="background-color:#009945; ">
               </span>
              </strong>

    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-1136">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle first avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              EMABG Scholars
             </h4>
             <p>
              The EMABG welcomes leading academics and practitioners in subjects related to animal breeding and genetics to join the programme as invited guest lecturers.
             </p>
             <p>
              The scholars and guest lecturers contribute to the EMABG programme with lectures on the state of the art of topics from animal breeding and genetics, and provide their vision for the future topics. We invite world-known experts to teach whole courses or give lectures on their field of expertise. This is not only limited to animal breeding scientists, but may also include experts from neighbouring fields (e.g. plant breeding, conservation genetics) or from basic science fields (e.g. statistics, molecular genetics, and bioinformatics).
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left avia-full-stretch flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle avia-builder-el-4 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background:url(https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Picture-by-Claude-Star-on-Pixabay-e1573140222330.jpg) center center no-repeat  #ededed; padding:00px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-5 avia-builder-el-no-sibling" style="height:200px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->
         <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-6 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half" style="height:40px">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left avia-full-stretch flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-7 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="background:url(https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Picture-by-Ulrich-Wechselberger-on-Pixabay-e1573458796156.jpg) center center no-repeat  #ededed; padding:00px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-8 avia-builder-el-no-sibling" style="height:200px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top avia-builder-el-9 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Eligibility
             </h4>
             <p>
              Guest lecturers are expected to hold courses or seminars in their field of expertise at a Consortium university within the EMABG programme.
             </p>
             <p>
              They can visit for the joint curricular elements (Welcome Course, Summer Course, …) or during the two years of the master programme at the Consortium universities.
             </p>
             <h4>
              Guest lecturers …
             </h4>
             <ul>
              <li>
               can come from institutions inside or outside the European Union
              </li>
              <li>
               should ideally spend a minimum of one week (four consecutive working days) at the host university
              </li>
              <li>
               must participate in the EMABG for the full duration of their stay
              </li>
              <li>
               must bring concrete added value to the programme and students
              </li>
              <li>
               must have adequate health, accident and travel insurance coverage, including repatriation costs and civic liability coverage
              </li>
              <li>
               must sign the EMABG scholar agreement before starting their activities
              </li>
              <li>
               must have an excellent level of English
              </li>
              <li>
               must fill in a scholar’s survey after the visiting scholar activity
              </li>
              <li>
               must provide a certificate of attendance from the respective Consortium university
              </li>
              <li>
               must contribute to the promotion and dissemination of the EMABG after their activity
              </li>
              <li>
               with special needs are encouraged to apply
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->
         <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-11 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half" style="height:40px">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-12 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              <strong>
               Selection
              </strong>
             </h4>
             <p>
              The applicants are evaluated by the EMABG consortium based on
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               their scientific and teaching quality
              </li>
              <li>
               their professional experience in the domain of animal breeding and genetics
              </li>
              <li>
               their contribution to the EMABG course and student employability
              </li>
              <li>
               and their application documents
              </li>
             </ul>
             <p>
              Applicants will be contacted for further information or regarding their proposed course contents.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top avia-builder-el-14 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">

            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              <strong>
               Scholarships
              </strong>
             </h4>
             <p>
              Invited scholars will receive:
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               EUR 130€ per day for accommodation and subsistence.
              </li>
              <li>
               travel costs will be reimbursed based on the real costs for economy/2
               <sup>
                nd
               </sup>
               class tickets, i.e. on the invoices submitted.
               <br/>
               Participants have to ask the EMABG coordinator at BOKU for approval of the planned travel costs
               <strong>
                before
               </strong>
               booking their flight/train etc.
              </li>
             </ul>
             <p>
              To apply, please fill in the
              <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/EMABG_scholars_applicationform_neu.docx">
               application form available under this link
              </a>
              and submit it to our e-mail address together with the requested documents.
             </p>

             <h4>

             </h4>
             <p>
              Read the latest
              <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/emabg-news/">
               news
              </a>
              on EMABG!
             </p>
             <p>
              Find out more about the
              <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/costs-scholarships/costs/">
               costs
              </a>
              of the programme.
             </p>
             <p>
              EMABG is an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) co-funded by the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union. A limited number of scholarships covering EMABG participation costs are available to excellent students. Have a look at the information on EMJMDs and other
              <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/costs-scholarships/emjmd/">
               scholarship options.
              </a>
             </p>
             <p>
              EMABG scholarship holders will be insured comprehensively by
              <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/costs-scholarships/insurance/">
               Expat & Co
              </a>
              .
             </p>
             <p>
              EMABG-relevant documents are collected under the
              <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/downloads/">
               downloads

              section.

    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-642">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="avia_message_box avia-color-custom avia-size-large avia-icon_select-yes avia-border- avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" id="avia-messagebox-" style="background-color:#e2372b; color:#ffffff; ">
          <span class="avia_message_box_title">
           Great news:
          </span>
          <div class="avia_message_box_content">
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="avia_message_box_icon" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello">
           </span>
           <p>
            There are scholarships available for intake in 2025! Additionally, we have extended the deadline for applications until 28 February 2025.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-3 el_after_av_notification el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              EMABG participation costs
             </h4>
             <p>
              The EMABG is a 2-year master’s programme.
             </p>
             <p>
              EMABG participation costs are €4,500 per year for students from Programme Countries and €9,000 per year for students from Partner Countries.
             </p>
             <p>
              A major part of the EMABG participation costs consists of tuition fees for the universities you will attend, and that is also the main reason for the difference in EMABG participation costs. Most partner universities have higher tuition fees for non-EU than for EU students.
             </p>
             <p>
              A limited number of scholarships covering EMABG participation costs are available, mainly for students from Partner Countries. Please have a look at the exact possibilities for scholarships.
             </p>
             <h4>
              EMABG participation costs cover:
             </h4>
             <ul>
              <li>
               participation at the introduction course / Welcome Course (accommodation costs are not covered)
              </li>
              <li>
               tuition fees to the host university of year 1
              </li>
              <li>
               participation at the summer course (accommodation costs are not covered)
              </li>
              <li>
               tuition fees to the host university of year 2
              </li>
              <li>
               participation at the Graduation Ceremony (accommodation costs are not covered)
              </li>
              <li>
               Student insurance costs (health and liability) for both years of the EMABG programme
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top avia-builder-el-5 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h3>
              Programme Country or Partner Country
             </h3>
             <ul>
              <li>
               <h4>
                Programme Countries:
               </h4>
               <p>
                Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and in addition: The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Serbia, Turkey
               </p>
              </li>
              <li>
               <h4>
                Partner Countries:
               </h4>
               <p>
                All other countries
               </p>
              </li>
             </ul>
             <h3>
              Dual Nationality
             </h3>
             <p>
              Students with dual nationality (of a Partner and of a Programme Country) must specify the nationality under which they submit their scholarship application.
             </p>
             <h3>
              12-months rule
             </h3>
             <p>
              Students who are not residents nor have carried out their main activity (studies, training or work) for more than a total of 12 months over the last five years in a Programme Country, count as Programme Country students. The five-year reference period for this 12-months rule is calculated backwards as from the submission deadline defined by the consortia of applying for an EMJMD student scholarship.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->
         <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-7 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half" style="height:40px">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-8 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h3>
              What other costs can be expected?
             </h3>
             <p>
              The EMABG participation costs do not cover costs for travel, living and stay. An average of €1,400 per month for the total duration of the programme (24 months) should be taken into account, which will be needed for living (food, study books, other expenses), accommodation (room rent during the various parts of the programme), and travel (to and from Europe, travel between location of Welcome Course, first and second host universities).
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left avia-full-stretch flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top avia-builder-el-10 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background:url(https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Bild-von-Juraj-Varga-auf-Pixabay-e1568276484579.jpg) center center no-repeat  #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-11 avia-builder-el-no-sibling" style="height:200px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>

          <div class="flex_column av_one_full av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-13 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h3>
              Application for self-paying students
             </h3>
             <p>
              If you are interested in joining the EMABG as a self-paying student, please send an e-mail to the
              <a href="https://www.emabg.eu/contact/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               EMABG central office
              </a>
              to inform us that you are interested.
             </p>
             <p>
              <strong>
               Note: The stated deadlines are the dates when your documents need to be in the first year university’s system. You have to submit your complete application documents to the EMABG Consortium at least three weeks before theses dates.
              </strong>
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>

     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-644">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="avia_message_box avia-color-custom avia-size-large avia-icon_select-yes avia-border- avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" id="avia-messagebox-" style="background-color:#e2372b; color:#ffffff; ">
          <span class="avia_message_box_title">
           Great news:
          </span>
          <div class="avia_message_box_content">
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="avia_message_box_icon" data-av_icon="" data-av_iconfont="entypo-fontello">
           </span>
           <p>
            There are scholarships available for intake in 2025! Additionally, we have extended the deadline for applications until 28 February 2025.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle first avia-builder-el-3 el_after_av_notification el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees
             </h4>
             <p>
              An
              <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degrees_en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree
              </a>
              (EMJMD) is a prestigious, integrated, international study programme, jointly delivered by an international consortium of higher education institutions.
             </p>
             <p>
              EMJMDs award EU-funded scholarships to the best student candidates applying under annual selection rounds.
             </p>
             <p>
              Study must take place in at least two of the Programme countries. Part of the studies can also take place in a Partner country if there is a Partner country institution involved.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle avia-builder-el-5 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Goals
             </h4>
             <ul>
              <li>
               Foster quality improvements, innovation, excellence and internationalisation in higher education institutions (HEI).
              </li>
              <li>
               Increase the quality and attractiveness of the European Higher Education Area (EHEA) and supporting the EU’s external action in the higher education field by offering full degree scholarships to the best Master students worldwide.
              </li>
              <li>
               Improve the level of competences and skills of Master graduates, and in particular the relevance of the double degree Masters for the labour market, through an increased involvement of employers.
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->
         <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-7 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half" style="height:40px">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top first avia-builder-el-8 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              EMJMD scholarship
             </h4>
             <p>
              A limited number of highly competitive EMJMD scholarships, provided by the Education, Audiovisual and Culture Executive Agency of the European Union are available that cover participation, living and travel costs.
             </p>
             <p>
              <strong>
               Tuition fees and insurance are covered by programme. Scholarships are meant to cover food, accommodation and travel costs. Monthly scholarships – 1400 Euro.
              </strong>
             </p>
             <p>
              Please note that students …
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               who have
               <strong>
                already received an EMJMD
               </strong>
               or an Erasmus Mundus Master Course/Joint Doctorate scholarship are
               <strong>
                not eligible
               </strong>
               ;
              </li>
              <li>
               cannot receive subsistence costs in their
               <strong>
                country of residence
               </strong>
               (at the time of their application);
              </li>
              <li>
               have to
               <strong>
                pre-finance their travel expenses
               </strong>
               to the first year university or university where the Welcome Course takes place;
              </li>
              <li>
               will receive travel and installation costs on their European bank account
               <strong>
                AFTER THEIR ARRIVAL
               </strong>
               ;
              </li>
              <li>
               have to cover their own
               <strong>
                accommodation costs
               </strong>
               during the Welcome Course, Summer School or Graduation Event;
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-top avia-builder-el-10 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Explanation Programme Country & Partner Country
             </h4>
             <p>
              Programme countries can fully take part in all the Actions of the Erasmus+ Programme: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom and in addition: The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Serbia, Turkey
             </p>
             <p>
              Partner Countries can take part in certain Actions of the Programme, subject to specific criteria or conditions. For more information about the criteria and a list of the Partner Countries see the relevant section in the
              <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/programme-guide/part-a/who-can-participate/eligible-countries_en">
               Erasmus+ Programme Guide
              </a>
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->

          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle first avia-builder-el-13 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Get your own funding source
             </h4>
             <p>
              Besides the presented scholarship schemes a lot of other global or national organisations offer fellowships. Its strongly advised to check the different available options. Please be aware that the fellowship application process is a lengthy process. Often an admission letter is required in the fellowship application process. For that reason you must start your application for admission at the university well in advance. Other fellowship opportunities:
             </p>
             <p>
              <a href="https://www.studyinholland.nl/study/scholarships/find-a-scholarship">
               Grantfinder
              </a>
             </p>
             <p>

              </a>
             </p>
             <p>

              </a>

              </a>
             </p>
             <p>
              <a href="https://www.universite-paris-saclay.fr/en/admission/bourses-et-aides-financieres/international-masters-scholarships-program-idex" rel="noopener" target="_blank">

              </a>
             </p>
             <p>
              <a href="https://studyinsweden.se/scholarships/swedish-institute-scholarships/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">

              </a>
             </p>
             <p>

               Study in Norway
              </a>
             </p>
             <p>

              </a>
             </p>
             <p>

               Educations.com

             </p>
             <p>
              <a href="https://www.topuniversities.com/student-info/scholarship-advice/scholarships-study-europe" rel="noopener" target="_blank">

              </a>
             </p>
             <p>
              <a href="http://campusbourses.campusfrance.org/fria/bourse/#/catalog" rel="noopener" target="_blank">

             </p>
             <p>

               China scholarship council for China

             </p>
             <p>
              <a href="https://eca.state.gov/fulbright" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               Fulbright Program
              </a>
             </p>
             <p>

              </a>
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>

      <div class="av-parallax-inner main_color avia-full-stretch" style="background-color: #ededed; background-repeat: no-repeat; background-image: url(https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/SLIDE_02b.jpg);background-attachment: scroll; background-position: center center; ">

     <div class="container">
      <main class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units" itemprop="mainContentOfPage" role="main">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-646">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
          <div class="avia_textblock av_inherit_color" itemprop="text" style="color:#ffffff; ">
           <h2>
            Insurance
           </h2>
          </div>
         </section>
        </div>

    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-646">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half av-animated-generic right-to-left flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle first avia-builder-el-2 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="background: #ededed; padding:40px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h5>
              <em>
               Stomach pains, toothache, mental problems? Go see a doctor! You are covered abroad by your international health insurance policy. However, not all treatments are covered.
              </em>
              <br/>
              <em>
               To make sure your treatment costs are covered, we recommend informing yourself prior to any treatment about the provided services and exclusions of benefits under your insurance policy.
               <br/>
              </em>
             </h5>
             <hr/>
             <h4>
              Comprehensive insurance
             </h4>
             <p>
              All EMABG scholarship holders will be insured comprehensively by Expat&Co with a combination of overseas health insurance, personal liability insurance, accident insurance, assistance insurance and baggage insurance in accordance with the
              <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/erasmus-plus/beneficiaries-space/key-action-1-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degrees-2018_en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               EACEA’s minimum requirements
              </a>
              .
             </p>
             <p>
              For information on the insurance by Expat&Co, please visit
              <a href="https://expatinsurance.eu/en/study-insurances/student-insurance" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               Expat&Co
              </a>
              .
             </p>
             <h4>
              What to do in case of visiting a doctor:
             </h4>
             <ol>
              <li>
               Contact Expat&Co: +32 (0)2 463 04 04/claims(at)expatinsurance.eu and tell them about your illness.
               <br/>
               They will tell you which treatments are covered.
              </li>
              <li>
               Make an appointment at the doctor’s and mention that you are insured under Expat&Co insurance.
              </li>
              <li>
               Bring your insurance confirmation (printed or digital).
              </li>
              <li>
               Paying the invoices:
               <br/>
               a) In most cases, you will have to make an advance payment.
               <br/>
               Keep the original invoices.
               <br/>
               Forward them to the insurance company for reimbursement (use the claims form).
               <br/>
               b) In some cases of inpatient treatment at a hospital or clinic, they will cover the costs immediately.
              </li>
             </ol>
            </div>

          <div class="flex_column av_one_fifth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-4 el_before_av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">

           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Agnes studied in Göttingen and Paris
             </h4>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-7 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              Agnes Nyamiel from Uganda studied at University of Goettingen (UGOE, Germany) and AgroParisTech/Université Paris-Saclay (APT, France) from 2020 to 2022.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">
            <section class="avia-testimonial-row">
             <div class="avia-testimonial av_one_half flex_column no_margin avia-testimonial-row-1 avia-first-testimonial" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person">
              <div class="avia-testimonial_inner">
               <div class="avia-testimonial-content" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
                <p>
                 <strong>
                  “Studying abroad was the best decision that I ever made
                 </strong>
                 ”
                </p>
                <p>
                 My life has changed greatly from being worried about leaving my family back home and about the unknowns that awaited me in this new part of the world to being an international traveler and scholar.
                </p>
                <p>
                 I had spent months learning how to adjust to a new lifestyle and academics in Göttingen and Paris, so I had convinced myself that I was perfectly prepared for my MSc and relocating to a new country. But I came to understand that although everything seemed ideal in my thoughts, there were unexpected challenges when I got there. However, I used this as a chance to push myself and adapt to the new environment.
                </p>
                <p>
                 The way that EMABG is organised is really great. The EMABG is an exceptional study programme that gives students the opportunity to study at two of the best universities in Europe and to interact with a diverse group of students from around the globe. Students in this programme are taught skills necessary for careers in academics and industry abroad. Students have plenty of time to concentrate more on their studies and worry less about paperwork thanks to the dedication of the coordinators from all the associated universities.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Through this programme, I was able to establish connections with leading plant and animal breeders and scientists from several countries through, among other things, internships and summer schools. I’m also happy I went to Göttingen University because it has such a diverse student body. There are a wide variety of nationalities and cultures represented among the students here. They are dedicated to achieving their own objectives, have a wide range of philosophies and religious views, and have a broad range of interests.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Similarly, AgroParisTech (University Paris Saclay) is located in the heart of Paris and is an attractive study destination as it offers everything from dynamic nightlife to top-notch universities to an exciting pace of life. But all of these come at a price. High rental costs and a dense population within the city make it hard to decide where to live in Paris as a student.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Through all the skills and experiences, I gained from EMABG, I was able to join the University of Padova in Italy on 6-month a research fellowship and later moved to Toulouse, France, to start a 3-year PhD programme at a French top research institute (INRAE).
                </p>
                <p>
                 Thanks, EMABG!
                </p>
               </div>

            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              Bernadett Hegedűs from Austria and Hungary studied at Wageningen University (WU, the Netherlands) and Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences (SLU, Sweden) from 2020 to 2022.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">
            <section class="avia-testimonial-row">
             <div class="avia-testimonial av_one_half flex_column no_margin avia-testimonial-row-1 avia-first-testimonial" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person">
              <div class="avia-testimonial_inner">
               <div class="avia-testimonial-content" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
                <p>
                 “One of the things that I loved about the EMABG is that I could study at two different universities yet the administrational burden was negligible. The coordination from Vienna was great and let us students concentrate on our studies. I furthermore appreciate the curriculum that allowed both students that wanted to stay in academia and students that wanted to start working in the industry an appropriate education. There were enough opportunities to network with breeding companies in form of invited speakers and internships. I think I also benefited a lot from the willingness of teachers at both universities to take time for students to answer questions and start discussions on relevant topics. The academic skills acquired during my master’s prepared me to be able start my PhD studies at a leading university in the field. Last but not least one should not forget the international aspect of this programme. There are so many things that I have learned about different cultures just by talking to my fellow classmates that cannot be quantified. I hope this programme will persist for a long time so that other students can experience it!”
                </p>

           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-35 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">

           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              David McGill from Australia applied for the European Master in Animal Breeding and Genetics and studied at Wageningen University (WU) from 2011-2012.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">
            <section class="avia-testimonial-row">
             <div class="avia-testimonial av_one_half flex_column no_margin avia-testimonial-row-1 avia-first-testimonial" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person">
              <div class="avia-testimonial_inner">
               <div class="avia-testimonial-content" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
                <p>
                 “The 6 universities provide a wealth of knowledge and experience as well as a diverse array of opportunities for the future”
                </p>
                <p>
                 “When I was searching the internet for places I would like to study, the EM-ABG course really caught my attention due to its strong international connections. The link between the genetic research groups of 6 European Universities is a great asset to the course as it provides a wealth of knowledge and experience as well as a diverse array of opportunities for the future.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Another interesting aspect that drew me to this course was the link to research outside Europe, especially in developing countries. Many of the academic staff involved in this program has carried out research in places like Africa and Asia. I find this really interesting as not only do the scientists get to carry out research in their field of choice, but they are also given the opportunity to have a real impact on the lives of the people in those places.
                </p>
                <p>
                 I hope that this program will provide me with a sound basis of knowledge regarding genetic improvement in livestock as well as professional links I can use in my career to have research opportunities throughout the world.”
                </p>
               </div>

             </h4>
            </div>

           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-44 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">

           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              Fuyong Li from China participated in the EMABG programme from 2010-2012. He studied one year at BOKU in Austria and continued the second year at Wageningen University in the Netherlands.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">
            <section class="avia-testimonial-row">
             <div class="avia-testimonial av_one_half flex_column no_margin avia-testimonial-row-1 avia-first-testimonial" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person">
              <div class="avia-testimonial_inner">
               <div class="avia-testimonial-content" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
                <p>
                 “The EMABG programme provided a good preparation for achieving my goal to pursue a PhD position.”
                </p>
                <p>
                 Fuyong was born in China. He was fascinated by animal genetics in high school. He did the Bachelor program of Agriculture in Animal Science in Northwest A&F University, China. Afterwards, he sought to experience higher standard of education in Europe and gained the opportunity to join the EM-ABG program. “I found out about the program via the internet. The 5 involved universities of this program have the most advanced education and research level in terms of Animal Breeding and Genetics, which is extremely beneficial for my knowledge and ability improvement.”
                </p>
                <p>
                 During the first year of the EM-ABG program, Fuyong went to BOKU in Vienna. “My first year study experiences in BOKU are memorable and awesome. Here we could make our study plans ourselves, so I took various courses in different fields including Molecular Genetics, Quantitative Genetics and Biological Science. I also acquired an internship chance in the University of Veterinary Medicine Vienna (Vetmeduni) to learn some laboratory skills in respect of Molecular Genetics.” During his second year, Fuyong has studied in Wageningen. “First, I have done an internship to prepare for my MSc thesis in the field of Dairy Cattle and Milk Science. Then, I followed some courses which prepared me for my future research. Afterwards, I did my MSc thesis .”
                </p>
                <p>
                 Next to the quality and the possibilities in the EM-ABG program, Fuyong also liked to study in Europe. “This program enables me to experience multinational European cultures. I built good friendships with numerous colleagues from different countries. Now I possess great friends from all over the world.”
                </p>
                <p>
                 Fuyong always aimed at doing a PhD after finishing the EM-ABG program, and he has found that position at the University of Alberta, Canada in the department of Agricultural, Food and Nutritional Science.  “This learning and research experience could build a strong platform for my future study. Pursuing pursue a PhD and being a scientist in this area has always been my career goal. The EMABG program provides me a good preparation for achieving this goal.”
                </p>
               </div>

        <div class="av-layout-tab-inner">

          <div class="flex_column av_one_fifth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-50 el_before_av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_three_fifth flex_column_div avia-builder-el-51 el_after_av_one_fifth el_before_av_one_fifth" style="background: #ededed; padding:30px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Mahlet studied in Wageningen and Vienna
             </h4>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-53 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">

            </span>
           </div>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              Mahlet Teka Anche from Ethiopia started her European Master in Animal Breeding and Genetics in 2009 at Wageningen University, the Netherlands. For the second year of the programme she moved to Austria, to study at BOKU University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences in Vienna.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">
            <section class="avia-testimonial-row">
             <div class="avia-testimonial av_one_half flex_column no_margin avia-testimonial-row-1 avia-first-testimonial" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person">
              <div class="avia-testimonial_inner">
               <div class="avia-testimonial-content" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
                <p>
                 “I met lots of people from all over the world and experienced the life in Europe for the first time.”
                </p>
                <p>
                 “My name is Mahlet, I’m from Ethiopia. I finished my bachelor degree in animal and range sciences five years ago from Awassa University, College of Agriculture, in Ethiopia. After that, I started working as a graduate assistant for the department of animal sciences, for the nutrition section in the University where I graduated.
                </p>
                <p>
                 After working there for almost 2 years, I decided to pursue my Masters and then applied for two scholarship programs, one for the EMABG scholarship and also for Vilr-uos scholarship In Aquaculture. Fortunately, I was offered both of the scholarships. Even though it was tough to decide between the two fields of study, after thorough research on what subjects will be covered in each of the scholarships, I finally decided that I wanted to pursue my study in Animal breeding and genetics.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Then three years ago I came to The Netherlands and did my first year masters study at Wageningen University. Even though it was a challenging year for me, I enjoyed my stay here in Wageningen. As I expected, I was satisfied by all the courses I took and the thesis experience I had. I met lots of people from all over the world and experienced the life in Europe for the first time in my life.
                </p>
                <p>
                 After that I went to Vienna, Austria for my second year study. I also enjoyed my stay at BOKU, University of Life Sciences. And finally, I graduated by the end of June, 2011. One important feature of the EMABG program that I like the most is the fact that we have to rotate among the different Universities. For me, moving from one university to another gives me an opportunity to improve my weakness that I thought they were during my first year study.
                </p>
                <p>
                 While I was doing my second year masters study, I applied for a PhD program in Wageningen. And I got the position there and now, I’m in my second year of my PhD. The project focuses on Modelling of interaction between individuals and its consequence of selection for improved resistance to infectious disease. I’m working with two supervisors, one from Animal Breeding and Genomics group (ABGC) and one from Quantitative Veterinary Epidemiology (QVE). I really like what I’m doing and I’m hopeful to be a successful PhD candidate.”
                </p>
               </div>

           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">

             <h4>
              Amabel studied in Wageningen and Paris
             </h4>
            </div>

           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-62 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">

           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              Amabel Tenghe from Cameroon started her EMABG programme in 2008 at Wageningen University in the Netherlands. In 2009 she continued the master course at AgroParisTech in France.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">
            <section class="avia-testimonial-row">
             <div class="avia-testimonial av_one_half flex_column no_margin avia-testimonial-row-1 avia-first-testimonial" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person">
              <div class="avia-testimonial_inner">
               <div class="avia-testimonial-content" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
                <p>
                 “The MSc program I’ve participated in really gives me an advantage in the work that I’m doing now.”
                </p>
                <p>
                 Amabel was born in Cameroon where she did her BSc program at the university of Buea. She took the program of zoology. She loves to do research and when she saw that there was an opportunity to apply for the Erasmus Mundus program in Animal Breeding and Genetics she applied.
                </p>
                <p>
                 “I got accepted for the program and was invited to the university of Austria but my visa was not accepted, so I ended up to study my first year in Wageningen. In Wageningen I took courses for half a year and did a thesis the other half. My thesis was on quantitative genetics in fish.” For the second year of the course Amabel went to Paris to do again half a year courses and the other half a thesis. This time her thesis was a genome wide association study in pigs.
                </p>
                <p>
                 At this moment Amabel is pursuing her PhD in Belgium. She works at the GIGA research institute which is located within the University of Liege. “My work is on genomic selection in beef cattle. The MSc program I’ve participated in really gives me an advantage in the work that I’m doing now. In my work I use a combination of the research methods I’ve used in both my theses. The fact that I already had my position before I was even graduated from the Erasmus Mundus program tells me that this program is really a good start for anyone’s future.” But Amabel also wants to warn future students: “Do not go solely for the sponsored program. You will need devotion to complete it. Before you apply define your point of interest, plan your future and know where you want to end up.”
                </p>
               </div>

          <div class="flex_column av_three_fifth flex_column_div avia-builder-el-69 el_after_av_one_fifth el_before_av_one_fifth" style="background: #ededed; padding:30px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Vicky studied in Wageningen and Vienna
             </h4>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-71 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">

           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              Vicky Hunt from the USA participated in the EMABG programme from 2007-2009. She studied both at Wageningen University, the Netherlands, and at BOKU in Vienna, Austria.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">
            <section class="avia-testimonial-row">
             <div class="avia-testimonial av_one_half flex_column no_margin avia-testimonial-row-1 avia-first-testimonial" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person">
              <div class="avia-testimonial_inner">
               <div class="avia-testimonial-content" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
                <p>
                 “The EMABG program was a truly unique cultural and educational experience.”
                </p>
                <p>
                 Participating in EMABG was an amazing, eye-opening experience for me. I got to meet and make friends with people from all over the world, and I got to live in two European countries for long enough to really get a feel for life and culture there. I went to WUR (Netherlands) and BOKU (Austria).  Living in Vienna, Austria, was particularly interesting, and I felt that I was able to reach a good balance between school work and social/cultural life.  I learned to waltz (poorly!) and had a great time visiting museums, music venues, and palaces in Vienna. I also have fond memories of visiting farms for field trips in the countryside in Austria, which was absolutely beautiful.
                </p>
                <p>
                 I am interested in conservation, and EMABG faculty facilitated this interest in my thesis work.  Following completion of my Master’s degree, I began working at Lincoln Park Zoo in Chicago, Illinois, as Coordinator of Wildlife Management. After three years at the zoo, I began working at the Chicago Botanic Gardens, where I am Adaptive Management Projects Coordinator. In this role I helped develop decision tools for conservation projects such as native prairie restoration. I am currently also a PhD candidate at University of Illinois at Chicago, in the Ecology and Evolution Department.
                </p>
                <p>
                 I didn’t really know what to expect when I applied for EMABG.  Overall, it was a truly unique cultural and educational experience, and I am grateful for having had the opportunity to participate in the program.  I’m still in contact with good friends I made through the program, and I hope to maintain these friendships well into the future.
                </p>
               </div>

         <div class="container">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_fifth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-77 el_before_av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_three_fifth flex_column_div avia-builder-el-78 el_after_av_one_fifth el_before_av_one_fifth" style="background: #ededed; padding:30px; background-color:#ededed; border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4>
              Karina studied in Oslo and Wageningen
             </h4>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-80 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              Karina Hauge Johansen from Norway studies from 2012-2014 at the Norwegian University of life sciences (NMBU, Norway) and Wageningen University (WU, The Netherlands).
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">
            <section class="avia-testimonial-row">
             <div class="avia-testimonial av_one_half flex_column no_margin avia-testimonial-row-1 avia-first-testimonial" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person">
              <div class="avia-testimonial_inner">
               <div class="avia-testimonial-content" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
                <p>
                 “My dream job is to work on breeding programmes that improve the welfare of commercial animals”
                </p>
                <p>
                 My name is Karina (24) and I come from Norway. I finished my bachelor degree in Animal Science the spring of 2012 at the Norwegian University of life sciences (NMBU). I had decided quite early that I wanted to take a full Master’s degree, and planned to continue for two more years at NMBU. During writing my bachelor thesis, I got an email from one of the study advisers. She wrote that she had an idea, since I had told her before that I was not sure of which specialization within animal science I wanted to follow. She told me that there was this international program called European Master in Animal Breeding and Genetics where I could choose two universities to study abroad. I could be abroad for the full two years, or only one year, all depending on what I wanted. The program would give me an international double degree, and a chance to custom make my study plan, so I could get “the best of both worlds”. Being in a true international environment would also give me invaluable experience and input from different cultures.
                </p>
                <p>
                 At first I thought that this program sounded way out of my comfort zone, and it was much easier to just stay at home in my own country. I already had an apartment, friends and everything. So why leave? But then again, I had started to figure out that it really was the genetic and breeding part of animal sciences that came closest to my interest. Maybe that was what I wanted to choose for my specialization?
                </p>
                <p>
                 Several days later I could not get rid of the thought of me missing out on something. The more I thought about it, the more boring did my original plan sound. But I did not quite feel that I was done being at NMBU, and I did have the opportunity to choose NMBU as the first university, and another one abroad the next year. Maybe that could be the solution. I finally came to the conclusion that I wanted to apply for it. If I got in, I would do it, if not, I would stay at NMBU. It was a win, win situation.
                </p>
                <p>
                 At the end of summer, I got the message that I was accepted to EMABG, and I felt really excited! The introduction course in The Netherlands was nothing but fun and inspiring, and the world suddenly felt a lot bigger at the same time as I felt safe and welcomed. To meet so many nice people from all over the world was exciting, and I made new friends right away. Now I can’t wait to do the second year away from home.
                </p>
                <p>
                 I have not given that much thought in what I want to work with after graduation. I am generally interested in most production animals, and also the wildlife, and it is a lot of subjects within animal breeding that I find intriguing. But I have always been an animal welfare activist, so my “dream job” would be something that can give me the opportunity to save endangered animals through sustainable breeding programs, or be a part of bettering the welfare of commercial animals by making breeding programs that will protect the genetic variation and include more health traits.
                </p>
               </div>
               <div class="avia-testimonial-meta">
                <div class="avia-testimonial-arrow-wrap">
                 <div class="avia-arrow">
                 </div>
                </div>

                 </span>

         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_three_fifth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-86 el_after_av_one_fifth el_before_av_one_fifth" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <div class="avia-image-container av-styling- avia-builder-el-87 avia-builder-el-no-sibling avia-align-center" itemprop="image" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
           <div class="avia-image-container-inner">
            <div class="avia-image-overlay-wrap">

             </h4>

           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-8 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">

           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              Employer: H&N International
              <br/>
              Position: Junior Geneticist at the R&D Department (Genetics)
              <br/>
              Tasks:
              <br/>
              – Performance recording in pureline and crossline test farms
              <br/>
              – Estimation of genetic parameters
              <br/>
              – Parent-stock pipeline optimization
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">
            <section class="avia-testimonial-row">
             <div class="avia-testimonial av_one_half flex_column no_margin avia-testimonial-row-1 avia-first-testimonial" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/Person">
              <div class="avia-testimonial_inner">
               <div class="avia-testimonial-content" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
                <p>
                 Positive:
                 <br/>
                 – Quality of education in multicultural environments
                 <br/>
                 – EMABG constant office support
                 <br/>
                 – Welcome course and Summer school
                </p>
                <p>
                 Negative:
                 <br/>
                 – No programming courses
                 <br/>
                 – Fixed courses (no options to choose others)
                 <br/>
                 – Unadjusted stipend for life costs in Scandinavia
                </p>
               </div>

           <div class="avia-testimonial-wrapper avia-slider-testimonials avia-slider-2-testimonials avia_animate_when_almost_visible" data-animation="fade" data-autoplay="1" data-hoverpause="1" data-interval="10">

                </p>

                <div class="avia-testimonial-arrow-wrap">

            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h4 class="form-input-wide">
              Felicien Shumbusho (Rwanda): Director of Animal Genetic Improvement (currently living in Rwanda)
             </h4>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-107 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">

            </span>
           </div>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <p>
              Felicien Shumbusho is an Animal Genetics and Breeding scientist and Director of animal genetic Improvement at Rwanda Agriculture Board. He is trained in animal genetics and breeding (MSc and PhD) and has excellent skills in genomics data manipulations and analysis and designing and evaluating breeding programs. His current activities include revising and improving the Rwanda animal breeding programs; implementing research and extension projects that meet national priorities in animal breeding; coordinating the development and implementation of animal identification, registration and recording systems; ensure the training of staff and farmers in appropriate skills in livestock breeding management e.g. recording and records keeping, use of reproductive technologies, etc.
             </p>
             <p>
              Tasks:
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               Coordinating of National Animal Genetic Improvement activities, including – planning, – bulls selection and maintenance, Semen production and processing, artificial insemination service delivery, monitoring, etc;
              </li>
              <li>
               Supervising the capacity building of stakeholders in animal breeding;
              </li>
              <li>
               Strengthening partnership with national, regional, and international institutions for promotion of access to improved animal genetics, and breeding tools;
              </li>
              <li>
               Coordinating extension educational activities in the form of demonstration, technician and farmers training sessions;
              </li>
              <li>
               Supervising the development and updating of a the National Animal Breeding policy;
              </li>
              <li>
               Developing of National Livestock recording system in Rwanda;
              </li>
             </ul>
             <p>
              <a href="http://www.rab.gov.rw/index.php?id=180" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               Institution’s Profile
              </a>
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>

                </p>
                <p>
                 I thank the team that developed this MSc programme and is continuing to offer great opportunities for training.

             <p>
              My current PhD research focuses on the endocrine regulation of calcium and phosphorus metabolism in pigs, specifically investigating the role of vitamin D and its metabolites in bone health. I aim to identify genetic loci associated with these factors using genome-wide association analysis (GWAS) techniques, and validate these associations through animal trials and molecular biological analyses. This work will contribute to a deeper understanding of the genetic determinants of bone health in pigs and its implications for breeding strategies and livestock production.
