    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_1" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-881">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-6 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Uppsala
            </h3>
           </div>
          </section>
          <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-8 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
           <span class="hr-inner">
            <span class="hr-inner-style">
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             Uppsala is Sweden’s fourth largest city. It has 185,000 inhabitants, of which 35,000 are students. Uppsala offers picturesque countryside on the one hand and the amenities of a bustling city on the other hand, with cultural and commercial activities, cafés, shops and a newly constructed concert hall. The river Fyrisån runs through downtown Uppsala and serves as an orientation landmark. Stockholm is just a forty-minute train ride away.
            </p>
            <p>
             Stroll along the banks of Fyrisån river and visit Uppsala’s 13th century cathedral or even older Viking monuments of Gamla Uppsala. Fjällnora Recreation Area, the Botanical Garden, Uppsala’s City Garden, a tropical greenhouse offer opportunities for relaxation in green surroundings.
            </p>
            <p>
             To find out more about Uppsala, visit the official
             <a href="https://www.destinationuppsala.se/en/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              visitor’s guide
             </a>
             .
             <br/>
             SLU provides information on
             <a href="https://www.slu.se/en/about-slu/locations/slu-uppsala/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              Uppsala and SLU’s campus
             </a>
             .
            </p>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-10 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_section avia-builder-el-last" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <div class="avia-image-container av-styling- avia-builder-el-11 avia-builder-el-no-sibling avia-align-left" itemprop="image" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
           <div class="avia-image-container-inner">
            <div class="avia-image-overlay-wrap">
             <img alt="" class="avia_image" height="400" itemprop="thumbnailUrl" src="https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/SLU_000.jpg" title="SLU_000" width="600"/>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>

    <div class="avia-section main_color avia-section-default avia-no-border-styling avia-bg-style-scroll avia-builder-el-12 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half container_wrap fullsize" id="av_section_2" style="background-color: #efefef;  ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-881">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-13 el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <div class="avia-image-container av-styling- avia-builder-el-14 avia-builder-el-no-sibling avia-align-center" itemprop="image" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
           <div class="avia-image-container-inner">
            <div class="avia-image-overlay-wrap">
             <img alt="SLU logo" class="avia_image" height="400" itemprop="thumbnailUrl" src="https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/LOGO_02.png" title="LOGO_02" width="495"/>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-15 el_after_av_one_half avia-builder-el-last" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences
            </h3>
           </div>
          </section>
          <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-17 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
           <span class="hr-inner">
            <span class="hr-inner-style">
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             The Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences is a young university. It was founded in 1977 out of agricultural, forestry and veterinary colleges and schools. It focuses on research, education as well as environmental monitoring and assessment in the field of clean water, living landscapes, sustainable food production, high standards of animal welfare, sustainable cities and renewable environmental material. SLU offers around 40 degree programmes in natural sciences, social sciences, technologies and the humanities. It is a member of three international educational networks and collaborates internationally within a number of international platforms for research and environmental assessment.
            </p>
            <p>
             SLU has 34 departments and units that are organised in four faculties. The university ranked as third best university in the field of “Agriculture and Forestry” and was on rank 22 in the field of “Veterinary Medicine” in the QS Ranking and among the top 10 institutions in forestry, soil science, biodiversity conservation and veterinary sciences in the Center for World University Rankings (CWUR).
            </p>
            <p>
             SLU Campus in Uppsala is located in Ultuna, about six kilometres south of downtown Uppsala. It can be reached via a 20 minutes’ bicycle ride. Uppsala campus is spacious, green and picturesque. Due to the fact that two universities are located in Uppsala, students can immerse themselves in a lively and stimulating environment. Find out more about
             <a href="https://www.slu.se/en/about-slu/locations/slu-uppsala/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              Uppsala campus
             </a>
             .
            </p>
            <p>
             Find more
             <a href="https://www.slu.se/en/about-slu/facts-visions-och-values/facts-and-figures/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              facts and figures
             </a>
             on SLU.
             <br/>
             Prepare for your stay using this
             <a href="https://student.slu.se/en/studies/new-student/check-list/checklist-for-international-master-students/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              checklist for international students
             </a>
             .
             <br/>
             Read about
             <a href="https://student.slu.se/en/study-support/study-support/study-and-career-advice/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              study and career guidance
             </a>
             at SLU.

     <div class="container">

        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-19 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_fourth avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">

            </small>

         <div class="flex_column av_one_fourth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-21 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_fourth" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Accommodation
            </h3>
           </div>
          </section>
          <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-23 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
           <span class="hr-inner">
            <span class="hr-inner-style">
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             Accommodation in Uppsala can be costly. Students can stay in dormitories, shared flats or private apartments. Put your name on the lists well in advance. SLU provides further information on
             <a href="https://student.slu.se/en/student-life/campuses/uppsala/accomodation-uppsala/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              accommodation in Uppsala
             </a>
             .
            </p>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_fourth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-25 el_after_av_one_fourth el_before_av_hr" style="border-radius:0px; ">
         </div>
         <div class="hr hr-default avia-builder-el-26 el_after_av_one_fourth el_before_av_one_half">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-27 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <div class="avia-image-container av-styling- av-has-copyright av-copyright-always avia-builder-el-28 avia-builder-el-no-sibling avia-align-right" itemprop="image" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
           <div class="avia-image-container-inner">

            </div>
            <small class="avia-copyright">
             Photo by Anna Johansson_SLU
            </small>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-29 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Residence Permit/Visa and Registration
            </h3>
           </div>
          </section>
          <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-31 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
           <span class="hr-inner">
            <span class="hr-inner-style">
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             This information will be updated soon!
            </p>
            <p>
             People who are planning to live in Sweden for a year or longer, need to register in the Swedish Population Register. To do so, visit
             <a href="https://www.skatteverket.se/servicelankar/otherlanguages/inenglish.4.12815e4f14a62bc048f4edc.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              Sweden’s Tax Agency offices
             </a>
             (servicekontor). Find out more about the process of
             <a href="https://www.skatteverket.se/servicelankar/otherlanguages/inenglish/individualsandemployees/movingtosweden.4.7be5268414bea064694c40c.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              registration and necessary documents
             </a>
             .
            </p>
            <p>
             Immigration procedures differ for students depending on their country of origin.
            </p>
            <h6>
            </h6>
           </div>
          </section>
          <div class="togglecontainer av-minimal-toggle toggle_close_all avia-builder-el-33 el_after_av_textblock avia-builder-el-last">
           <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
             <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-1" itemprop="headline">
              Students from EU/EEA Countries
              <span class="toggle_icon">
               <span class="vert_icon">
               </span>
               <span class="hor_icon">
               </span>
              </span>
             </p>
             <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-1-container">
              <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
               <ul>
                <li>
                 do NOT need to contact the Swedish Migration Agency (information can be found at
                 <a href="https://www.migrationsverket.se/English/Private-individuals/EU-citizens-and-long-term-residents/Work-study-or-live-in-Sweden-for-EU-citizens.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                  this page of the Swedish Migration Agency
                 </a>
                 )
                </li>
               </ul>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </section>
           <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
             <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-2" itemprop="headline">
              Students from Non-European countries
              <span class="toggle_icon">
               <span class="vert_icon">
               </span>
               <span class="hor_icon">
               </span>
              </span>
             </p>
             <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-2-container">
              <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
               <ul>
                <li>
                 Students who have a residence permit for studies in higher education in another EU country and who are studying in a Union programme or a multilateral programme that includes mobility measures, can live in Sweden for a period of no more than 360 days. The same is true for students of a programme covered by an agreement between two or more universities. Find
                 <a href="https://www.migrationsverket.se/English/Private-individuals/Studying-and-researching-in-Sweden/Notification-of-planned-mobility-studies.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                  more information on the homepage of the Swedish Migration Agency
                 </a>
                 .
                </li>
                <li>
                 These students have to:
                 <ul>
                  <li style="list-style-type: none;">
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   notify the Swedish Migration Agency BEFORE coming to Sweden
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   fill in the form that is linked on the website “Notification of stay in Sweden for studies in higher education”
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   There is no fee involved in this.
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   Attach all necessary documents, including a certificate that you will study in Sweden, issued by the Swedish university, your insurance confirmation and your scholarship acceptance letter, together with account statements that show your scholarship receipts
                  </li>
                 </ul>
                </li>
               </ul>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>

          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             Uppsala has a humid continental climate with considerably cold winters and warm summers. July is the warmest month with an average of 16 °C, while the average temperature in winter is -4 °C. Throughout the year there is a significant amount of rainfall. Snow occurs between November and March.
            </p>

           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             Cycling is the most popular means of transportation for students in Uppsala. It takes about half an hour to reach SLU from downtown Uppsala. In addition, Uppsala is connected to the Swedish transport system via city buses, regional buses, trains and commuter trains. 30-day student tickets are available. For information on prices and schedules visit

           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             Ås is a municipality in Akershus county, Norway. It is a small town, located in the South-East of Norway, about 40 km south of Oslo. Around 16,000 people live in the municipality. Norsk Landbruksmuseum (Norwegian Agriculture Museum) and Tusenfryd Amusement Park are two major sights of the city.
            </p>
            <p>
             To find out more about Ås, visit the
             <a href="http://www.as.kommune.no/">
              municipality’s homepage
             </a>
             .
             <br/>
             NMBU provides
             <a href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/studies/prospective-students/general_information" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              information on student life
             </a>
             .
            </p>

    <div class="avia-section main_color avia-section-default avia-no-border-styling avia-bg-style-scroll avia-builder-el-13 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half container_wrap fullsize" id="av_section_2" style="background-color: #efefef;  ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-872">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-14 el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <div class="avia-image-container av-styling- avia-builder-el-15 avia-builder-el-no-sibling avia-align-center" itemprop="image" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
           <div class="avia-image-container-inner">
            <div class="avia-image-overlay-wrap">
             <img alt="NMBU logo" class="avia_image" height="400" itemprop="thumbnailUrl" src="https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/LOGO_03.png" title="LOGO_03" width="495"/>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-16 el_after_av_one_half avia-builder-el-last" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Norwegian University of Life Sciences
            </h3>
           </div>
          </section>
          <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-18 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
           <span class="hr-inner">
            <span class="hr-inner-style">
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             The Norwegian University of Life Sciences was established in 1859 and is the second oldest institution of higher education in Norway. NMBU’s interdisciplinary research and study programmes focus on the areas of food, health, environmental protection, climate and the sustainable use of natural resources. It is organized into eight departments, seven faculties and seven centers for research. NMBU offers 64 study programmes in Biosciences, Chemistry, Biotechnology, Environmental Sciences, Technology, Veterinary Medicine etc.
             <br/>
             NMBU is a leading university in the field of agriculture and forestry, ranking 23rd in the Qs World ranking.
            </p>
            <p>
             It hosts about 5,200 students. Almost 17 percent of NMBU’s students have a foreign citizenship and 43 percent of the study programmes are in English.
             <br/>
             Campus Ås covers a total of 600 ha and is home to one of Norway’s most beautiful parks, with a number of historical buildings, as well as Ås Farm, where research and teaching on traditional livestock are conducted.
             <br/>
             New international students are invited to a number of welcome and introduction events during their first days on campus, offered by
             <a href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/studies/exchange">
              Student Information Centre (SiT)
             </a>
             .
             <br/>
             Find out more about
             <a href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/studies/exchange/introduction">
              starting your studies at NMBU
             </a>
            </p>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <!-- close content main div -->
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="main_color av_default_container_wrap container_wrap fullsize" id="after_section_2" style=" ">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="template-page content av-content-full alpha units">
       <div class="post-entry post-entry-type-page post-entry-872">
        <div class="entry-content-wrapper clearfix">
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-20 el_after_av_section el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">
           <div class="avia-image-container av-styling- avia-builder-el-21 avia-builder-el-no-sibling avia-align-right" itemprop="image" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
            <div class="avia-image-container-inner">
             <div class="avia-image-overlay-wrap">
              <img alt="" class="avia_image" height="400" itemprop="thumbnailUrl" src="https://www.emabg.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/NBMU_02.jpg" title="house_snow" width="400"/>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-22 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h3>
              Accommodation
             </h3>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-24 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
             <p>
              Accommodation in Norway can be relatively expensive averaging to around NOK 4,800. Various types of accommodation are available, including single rooms, shared flats or dormitories. NMBU students can live on campus, find accommodation close to
              <span class="st">
               Ås
              </span>
              (e.g. Ski) or even in Oslo (easy to reach via public transport).
              <a href="https://www.sias.no/home/">
               SiÅs
              </a>
              offers student accommodation in dormitories. Rooms in dormitories need to be paid from July onwards to secure the spot for one semester or year. Students need to be registered in the NMBU student database before applying for on-campus housing, otherwise the access will be denied. Si
              <span class="st">
               Ås
              </span>
              also links to options for private accommodation. Private accommodation can also be found on
              <a href="https://www.finn.no" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               Finn.no
              </a>
              (use translate services). It is not uncommon that students rent a shared house together. Make sure to arrange your accommodation well in advance.
              <br/>
              For further information on accommodation, visit
              <a href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/studies/prospective-students/general_information#2">
               NMBU’s website
              </a>
              and have a look at NMBU’s pre-arrival guide for international students (linked below).
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->
         <div class="hr hr-default avia-builder-el-26 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_one_half">
          <span class="hr-inner">
           <span class="hr-inner-style">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="flex_column_table av-equal-height-column-flextable -flextable">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-27 el_after_av_hr el_before_av_one_half" style="border-radius:0px; ">
           <div class="avia-image-container av-styling- avia-builder-el-28 avia-builder-el-no-sibling avia-align-right" itemprop="image" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
            <div class="avia-image-container-inner">

             </div>

          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-29 el_after_av_one_half el_before_av_hr" style="border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h3>
              Residence Permit/Visa and Registration
             </h3>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-31 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
             <p>
              Immigration procedures differ for students depending on their country of origin.
             </p>
             <h6>
             </h6>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="togglecontainer av-minimal-toggle toggle_close_all avia-builder-el-33 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock">
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-1" itemprop="headline">
               Students from Nordic Countries (Denmark, Finland, Iceland or Sweden)
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-1-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <ul>
                 <li>
                  … staying for up to six months do not need to register their move
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  … staying for more than 6 months have to report to the
                  <a href="https://www.skatteetaten.no/en/person/foreign/you-must-notify-us-when-you-move/moving-to-norway/?170446=0" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                   Norwegian tax office
                  </a>
                  within 8 days of their arrival. This is free of charge. NMBU can assist students with the respective forms.
                 </li>
                </ul>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-2" itemprop="headline">
               Students from EU/EEA Countries (staying for more than 3 months)
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-2-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <ul>
                 <li>
                  need to register on the Norwegian Directorate of Immigration’s (UDI’s)
                  <a href="https://selfservice.udi.no/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                   application portal
                  </a>
                  and book an appointment with the local police station (book prior to arrival to Norway to avoid waiting times!)
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Students need to bring the following documents:
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    valid ID or passport
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    NMBU admission letter
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    European health card (valid for entire stay) or private health insurance (e.g. insurance by Dr. Walter provided for EMABG students)
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    handwritten or typed personal declaration stating that you have enough money to support yourself while studying in Norway. The declaration must be signed.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Students will receive a registration certificate which they need to carry with them at all times
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  This process is free of charge.
                 </li>
                </ul>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-3" itemprop="headline">
               Students from Non-European countries
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-3-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <ul>
                 <li>
                  staying for more than 3 months:
                  <strong>
                   must
                  </strong>
                  apply for a study permit (processing fee = NOK 4,900) or in some cases a tourist visa for stays under three months depending on country of citizenship
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  need to register on the Norwegian Directorate of Immigration’s (UDI’s)
                  <a href="https://selfservice.udi.no/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                   application portal
                  </a>
                  and book an appointment with the local police station (book prior to arrival to Norway to avoid waiting times!)
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Student need to bring the following documents:
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    valid ID or passport
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    NMBU admission letter
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Housing contract
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Documentation of financing: EMABG scholarship acceptance letter is sufficient. Warning: Rejections may occur at first but NMBU can assist in fixing this.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Students have to go to the police twice: 1. for submission of documents, 2. for having their picture and fingerprints taken
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  The residence permit is sent to NMBU 10 days afterwards and can be picked up from there.
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Non-EU students with a Norwegian residence permit will be covered by the Norwegian health system.
                 </li>
                </ul>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
           </div>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
             <h6>
             </h6>
             <p>
              Visit NMBU’s information on
              <a href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/studies/admission/study_permit" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               study permits,
              </a>
              the
              <a href="https://www.udi.no/en/want-to-apply/studies/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               Norwegian Directorate of Immigration
              </a>
              , or read NMBU’s pre-arrival guide (linked below) to find out more.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!--close column table wrapper. Autoclose: 1 -->

           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <h3>
             Climate
            </h3>
           </div>
          </section>
          <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-40 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">

          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             While in Western Norway the climate is mild and maritime, the climate is more continental in the Eastern part with warmer summers (around 20 °C) but longer and colder winters (-5 to -25 °C). The East is also considerably drier.
            </p>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>

          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             Public transportation in and around Ås is generally very good, however there are a few regions which have limited bus access. The
             <a href="https://ruter.no/en/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              Ruter
             </a>
             page or app can be used to find out about bus and train times and routes. Tickets can be bought via the app, at vending machines or some stores.
            </p>

          <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-56 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">

           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             The cost of living in Norway is considered relatively high compared to other European countries. You can expect to pay NOK 9,080 for your monthly subsistence costs. Find out more about
             <a href="https://www.nmbu.no/en/studies/exchange/introduction" rel="noopener" target="_blank">

           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
            <p>
             Paris is the capital city of France and is located in the North of the country. Paris is the European Union’s fifth largest city, having more than 2,2 million inhabitants and is also considered the most densely populated city in Europe. It is the political, economic and cultural centre of France and well connected to other major European cities via air, train and bus traffic.
            </p>
            <p>
             Paris is known as the “City of Love” and boasts attractions such as the world-famous Tour Eiffel, the Cathedral of Notre-Dame, the Louvre Museum and the Arc de Triophe de l’Etoile among many many others. The river Seine separates the city into two unequal parts with a number of islands in between.
            </p>
            <p>
             To find out more about Paris, visit the city’s
             <a href="https://www.paris.fr/">
              official website (in French)
             </a>
             or the
             <a href="https://en.parisinfo.com/">
              official website
             </a>
             of the Convention and Visitors Bureau.
            </p>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>

          <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-12 el_before_av_one_half avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">

             </div>

          <div class="av-flex-placeholder">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_half flex_column_table_cell av-equal-height-column av-align-middle av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-14 el_after_av_one_half avia-builder-el-last" style="border-radius:0px; ">
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
             <h3>
              AgroParisTech
             </h3>
            </div>
           </section>
           <div class="hr hr-invisible avia-builder-el-16 el_after_av_textblock el_before_av_textblock" style="height:20px">
            <span class="hr-inner">
             <span class="hr-inner-style">
             </span>
            </span>
           </div>
           <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
            <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text" style="font-size:14px; ">
             <p>
              AgroParisTech is an institute of higher education and research (“Grande Ecole”) that aims to address some of the most pressing challenges of our century: sustainable food provision, preservation of natural resources as well as support and integration of bioeconomy. Research and education at APT addresses the fields of agronomic sciences and technologies, forestry, life sciences, food technology, biotechnologies, environment, health, management of natural resources among others. It was founded in 2007 by three engineering grandes ecoles and since then has developed alliances with other major French institutions. It hosts 2,000 students, of which 20% are international students. In addition, it has 142 partnerships with foreign universities in 47 countries.
             </p>
             <p>
              APT is organised in 24 joint research units, 5 departments and 8 campuses (4 in Paris and the greater Paris area). In 2018 it ranked among the top 10 universities in the field of “Agriculture and Forestry” in the QS World University Ranking.
             </p>
             <p>
              <a href="https://www.agroparistech.fr/en/international-en-anglais-non-trad/study-abroad-agroparistech">
               APT’s Direction des Relations Internationales
              </a>
              provides information for international students seeking study or exchange programs.
             </p>
            </div>
           </section>
          </div>
         </div>

       </div>

            <p>
             Finding accommodation in Paris has its challenges. Opportunities for student accommodation include dormitories, on-campus residences, shared flats or private flats. Monthly rental costs range from € 450 to € 800. AgroParisTech can provide assistance in finding accommodation for international students but be sure to arrange accommodation well in advance. For more details, visit APT’s information on

            <p>
             Paris is located in the moderate climate zone influenced by the Atlantic Ocean. Temperatures reach an average of 18 °C in summer and around 3.5 °C in winter. Rainfall is well distributed over the year but slightly less frequent in summer.

            <p>
             Getting around by bus, trams trains or metro is quite easy in Paris. Paris Metro has 14 lines and operates until 1 am during the week and 2 am on the weekend with night buses that take over afterwards. Students can get discounts on public transport. For more information, maps and timetables for public transportation, visit
             <a href="https://www.ratp.fr/en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              RATP
             </a>
             .
             <br/>

             <a href="https://www.campusfrance.org/en/how-to-get-around-every-day-in-france" rel="noopener" target="_blank">

   function av_privacy_cookie_setter( cookie_name ) {var toggle = jQuery('.' + cookie_name);toggle.each(function(){if(document.cookie.match(cookie_name)) this.checked = false;});jQuery('.' + 'av-switch-' + cookie_name).each(function(){this.className += ' active ';});toggle.on('click', function(){if(this.checked){document.cookie = cookie_name + '=; Path=/; Expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:01 GMT;';}else{var theDate = new Date();var oneYearLater = new Date( theDate.getTime() + 31536000000 );document.cookie = cookie_name + '=true; Path=/; Expires='+oneYearLater.toGMTString()+';';}});}; av_privacy_cookie_setter('aviaPrivacyGoogleWebfontsDisabled');  av_privacy_cookie_setter('aviaPrivacyGoogleMapsDisabled');  av_privacy_cookie_setter('aviaPrivacyVideoEmbedsDisabled');

          <section class="av_textblock_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
           <div class="avia_textblock" itemprop="text">
            <p>
             University groups on Animal Breeding and Genetics within Europe have a long tradition of collaboration. The partner universities together form a consortium with a high level of expertise in every core subject in animal breeding and genetics, through which the EU can provide leadership for the development of a global training programme. Moreover, representatives of international organisations have joined the International Advisory Board which advises the consortium on the development of the course.
            </p>

            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-1" itemprop="headline">
               What are the most important deadlines for the EMABG programme?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-1-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 The stated months are estimates. Exact dates will follow:
                 <br/>
                 September: The new application round for a study start in summer of the following year will be launched
                 <br/>
                 February: Application deadline
                 <br/>
                 March: Selection Meeting
                 <br/>
                 April: Notification of Results
                 <br/>
                 August: Start of Study Programme
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-2" itemprop="headline">
               I do not understand what is meant by “study tracks”. Could you please explain?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-2-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 The set-up of EMABG is such that students study at two different universities (within the Consortium). The four study tracks differ in their scientific and thematic focus. When asking for your preferred study tracks, we would like you to list your preferences regarding the universities where you would want to study if you were selected for the EMABG programme.
                </p>
                <p>
                 You should indicate your preferred study tracks in your letter of motivation, e.g. NMBU-SLU, NMBU-WUR, NMBU-APT, NMBU-UGOE or NMBU-BOKU.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-3" itemprop="headline">
               Which English language tests are accepted for admission to the EMABG programme?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-3-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 The accepted English language tests are listed in the section regarding application and admission.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Please note that we
                 <strong>
                  do not make any exceptions
                 </strong>
                 .
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_one_fifth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-7 el_after_av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-last" style="border-radius:0px; ">

        <div class="av-layout-tab-inner">
         <div class="container">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_fifth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-9 el_before_av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_three_fifth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-10 el_after_av_one_fifth el_before_av_one_fifth" style="border-radius:0px; ">
           <div class="togglecontainer av-minimal-toggle toggle_close_all avia-builder-el-11 avia-builder-el-no-sibling">
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-4" itemprop="headline">
               I want to apply for the EMABG programme. What should I do?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-4-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 Once the new application period is launched, you can register to the EMABG application database. Follow the steps described to submit your documents to the EMABG Consortium. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-5" itemprop="headline">
               Is the application for scholarships the same as the application for applying for the master programme itself?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-5-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 When you apply for the EMABG programme, your application is considered for the EMJMD scholarships as well as for the master programme itself. The application deadlines are the same.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-6" itemprop="headline">
               I am still in my BSc studies. I will not graduate until the application deadline. What can I do?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-6-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <div class="GroupWiseMessageBody active" id="GroupWiseSection_1594799101000_nschwaig@groupwise.boku.ac.at_DE6B900118AD0000AF67776D34303131_">
                 <div>
                  <div>
                   Non-EU students can apply if they finish their studies (=graduation) until March 15th.
                   <br/>
                   EU students can apply if they finish their studies (=graduation) until July 1st.
                  </div>
                  <div>
                  </div>
                  <div>
                   Until the application deadline, these students have to upload a letter written, signed and stamped by their university that they will finish their studies until March 15th/July 1st.
                  </div>
                  <div>
                  </div>
                  <div>
                   Please understand that we
                   <strong>
                    cannot
                   </strong>
                   make exceptions from this rule.
                  </div>
                  <div>
                   If you don´t finish your studies before that, you are welcome to apply for
                   <strong>
                    the next call for applications
                   </strong>
                   . The period inbetween could be used to gather experiences in an internship, for example.
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-7" itemprop="headline">
               I already hold a Master’s degree. Can I still apply for the EMABG programme?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-7-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 Yes, you can apply even if you already have a Master’s degree. However, note that Goettingen University cannot accept students that already hold a Master’s in a similar field of studies.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-8" itemprop="headline">
               I have finished my Bachelor/Master studies in (name of study programme). Am I eligible to apply for the EMABG programme?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-8-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 Please check our information given in the section on application and admission.
                 <br/>
                 The EMABG Selection Committee needs to see your documents in order to decide if you are eligible for EMABG or not. Please upload your application documents to our application database.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-9" itemprop="headline">
               I am not sure if I am a Programme Country student or Partner Country student? What is the difference?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-9-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <h4>
                 Programme Countries:
                </h4>
                <p>
                 Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and in addition: The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Serbia, Turkey
                </p>
                <h4>
                 Partner Countries:
                </h4>
                <p>
                 All other countries
                </p>
                <h4>
                 Special rules:
                </h4>
                <ul>
                 <li>
                  Students who are not residents nor have carried out their main activity (studies, training or work) for more than a total of 12 months over the last five years in a Programme Country, count as Partner Country students. The five-year reference period for this 12-month rule is calculated backwards as from the submission deadline defined by the consortia of applying for an EMJMD student scholarship.
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Students with dual nationality (of a Partner and of a Programme Country) must specify the nationality under which they submit their scholarship application.
                 </li>
                </ul>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-10" itemprop="headline">
               I am from a Programme Country. Can I still apply for an EMABG scholarship?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-10-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 Yes. A limited number of scholarships is available to excellent candidates from EU as well as Non-EU countries. Students will be selected according to the criteria listed in the selection criteria.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Applicants that are eligible for studying EMABG but have not been selected for scholarships will get the chance to study the programme at their own costs or with the help of third party funding.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-11" itemprop="headline">
               I just started my Bachelor studies but your programme sounds interesting. Should I apply already, even though I will graduate in two years’ time?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-11-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 Please do not apply yet. The programme will accept student intakes until 2024. Please apply when the call for your respective start of studies is announced. Check our homepage for updates and news.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
           </div>
          </div>

       <div class="av-layout-tab av-animation-delay-container avia-builder-el-13 el_after_av_tab_sub_section el_before_av_tab_sub_section" data-av-tab-section-content="3" data-tab-section-id="documents" style="vertical-align:top; ">
        <div class="av-layout-tab-inner">
         <div class="container">
          <div class="flex_column av_one_fifth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding first avia-builder-el-14 el_before_av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-first" style="border-radius:0px; ">
          </div>
          <div class="flex_column av_three_fifth flex_column_div av-zero-column-padding avia-builder-el-15 el_after_av_one_fifth el_before_av_one_fifth" style="border-radius:0px; ">
           <div class="togglecontainer av-minimal-toggle toggle_close_all avia-builder-el-16 avia-builder-el-no-sibling">
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-12" itemprop="headline">
               I have a IELTS/TOEFL score that does not meet the overall score but my speaking and writing sub-scores meet the requirements. Will you still accept my application?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-12-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 The language proficiency requirements listed on our homepage are the official requirements demanded by our partner universities. The results of your language certificate need to meet the overall score as well as the speaking and writing sub-scores.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-13" itemprop="headline">
               The medium of instruction during my Bachelor studies was English. Do I still need to submit an official English language proficiency certificate?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-13-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 Please note the following conditions:
                </p>
                <ul>
                 <li>
                  Applicants who have completed their Bachelor or Master Degree in one of the following countries do not need to submit an English language proficiency certificate:
                  <br/>
                  Australia, Ireland, Canada (except those educated at universities in Quebec), New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States of America.
                 </li>
                </ul>
                <p>
                 <strong>
                  All other applicants have to submit sufficient results of an English language proficiency certificate as stated in the admission criteria.
                 </strong>
                 <br/>
                 Please note: The Consortium partners have the right to request any applicant to submit an English language proficiency test.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-14" itemprop="headline">
               What can I provide instead of a certificate of residence?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-14-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 The certificate of residence must be in English language and can be:
                </p>
                <ul>
                 <li>
                  a residence certificate issued in accordance with your municipality’s registration rules
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  your national ID, which must be dated and state your current address or merged with a document (e.g. electricity bill) that lists your name and address
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  a certificate from your place of work, study or training issued by the employer or institution in question. This certificate has to be dated and signed.
                 </li>
                </ul>
                <p>
                 These documents must have been issued within 12 months before the submission deadline of applying for an EMJMD student scholarship.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">
             <div class="single_toggle" data-tags="{All} ">
              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-15" itemprop="headline">
               I do not own a passport. Is it possible to apply without a passport?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-15-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 The passport is an important document to check your identity. Please make sure to upload your passport until the application deadline.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">

               <span class="toggle_icon">

                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <div class="toggle_wrap" id="toggle-id-16-container">
               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">
                <p>
                 If your university documents are in a language other than English, please make sure to upload the original documents, merged with an official English translation.
                </p>

              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">

                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>

            </section>
            <section class="av_toggle_section" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/CreativeWork">

               What kind of CV should I upload for my application?

                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>

                  Europass

                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>

               <div class="toggle_content invers-color" itemprop="text">

Remember to indicate your 1st, 2nd and 3rd preferred study track options and your motivation for choosing them.

              <p class="toggler" data-fake-id="#toggle-id-32" itemprop="headline">
               How high are my chances of receiving a EMJMD scholarship?
               <span class="toggle_icon">
                <span class="vert_icon">
                </span>
                <span class="hor_icon">
                </span>
               </span>
              </p>

                <p>

                </p>
                <ul>
                 <li>
                  Academic excellence including English language skills (final score share 40%)
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Motivation letter (final score share 25%)
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Work experience/professional qualifications/CV (final score share 25%) and
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Recommendation letters (final score share 10%).
                 </li>
                </ul>
                <p>
                 Available spaces will be filled up by the students from highest to lower ranks. Students who are not selected for scholarships but still received high scores will be able to participate in the programme if they can secure their own or third party funding.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>

     <div class="container">
